pageContext.desc: Farm and family life in Tazewell County, Illinois.

pages.transcription:
1871-1884
J. M Roberts

Dec. 5th 1871 very cold - 12º below zero clear & pleasant. snow 2 in deep. Ann washing today - Fuller & wife stopt to warm in their way to Peoria. Erastus called in - Lester gone to get a horse shod -
6th got a post office of $4.00 at Peoria Ills - No. 16350 - payable to Harper & Brothers N.Y.
8th Deacon Clark+ Albert Dean called here
9th Birth day - 64 yr. old. clear and cold. Kingsman called hear - going to Peoria to see about Insurance - stock. J. Durhams wife died in Peoria. Dr. Hendel of Peoria and Old Mr. Tharp of Pekin died.
13th - J.W.Clark & wife called here
14th 4º above zero - getting very dry
18th took 10 hogs to Peoria - average weight 437 lbs alive.  horses ran away with ___ broke it up some - hurt me some - cold day
19th snowy day
22nd snow storm to night is to be a concert at Morton church
23rd last night storm turned to rain thunder & lightning - this morning -  streams high
Thur. 46º - John A come home last night - the concert a failure - 
26th - killed 4 hogs
27th - 6º below zero high N.W. wind - snow squalls yesterday.

3250 ft deep sends up a jet 42 ft high nearly boiling water

Waterproof for boots & shoes
Tallow 4 oz Rosin & Beeswax each 1 oz.
melt together over a gentle fire then add equal bulk of neatsfoot oil - applied while warm before the fire - makes them both water proof & pliable.
1st house build in Bloomington by Col. James Sitta in the fall of 1831

Salvation
see. My sins deserve
eternal death, but Jesus
died for
me.
Dr. Valpy (?)
Heaviest Metal - is Osmium - specific gravity 224.77 - a cubic foot is 1,404 lb or more than 1/2 ton
Jan. 1st 1880
86,263 miles of RR in U.S.A.
Largest Bell in the World at Moscow  355,772 lb 19 ft high and 64 ft. around - cast in 1653 A.D.
Cure for Cholera
Take equal parts of tincture of Cayenne pepper - tincture of Opium, Tincture of Rhubarb essence of peppermint & spirits of camphor - mix well dose 15-30 drops in little cold water according to age & violence of symptoms.  Repeated in 15 or 20 minutes until relief is obtained.

1  January 1 - 1872
clear & pleasant - Wind N.E. roads getting muddy - Mary came home - Sister goes to Peoria to bring out performers to the concert to be held at the Church tonight
Jan. 24th
Zero - cold day - Protracted meeting in progress some interest manifested - 
25th 3º below - clear roads splendid - Watson Lockwood come here - day before yesterday - crops failed with him cannot pay anything.
27th 8º below zero - a real Norther - Mr. Houston staid here - is teaching a singing school - high wind and awful cold - only 2º above all day
29th  14º below 
30th 8º below
31st 1º below - snow squall last night
1st Feb. went to Peoria got 487 dollars to be laid by for Republic Insurance loss 
2nd Zero
3d 2º above - Meetings continues - much interest - some conversions
5th snow storm all day - meetings closed last evening
6th 11º below zero - snow 4-1/2 in deep clear & pleasant
7th 11º below went to Peoria with Mr. Kingman
8th wrote a letter to Elias Palmati_ - Panola
13th - a real Norther - lightning rod blew down - awful cold & windy all day
14th St. valentines day 8º below - flurries of snow
17th NE snow storm

1872
Feb. 22nd Lester B. Roberts married to Mary A. Dodds at 10 oclock AM and started for Galesburg.
23rd Beautiful spring day
Feb. 29th visited JWClark
Sarah's birthday 48 years
1st March dry roads good small pox in Peoria - schools all stopped
8th sleet - small pox on the increase in Peoria - 9 cases in one day - James Dever & WALyon in Peoria died
9th cooler & icy
March 19, 1872
Bought Nicholas Mosket farm of 53-1/3 acrs at 13-1/6 ac, wood land for $3500.00. $1,000 down $500 1st Dec. next, $500 1st Mar. 1873 $500 in a year, $500 in 2 years $500 in 3 years. Dr. Moss in Pekin died.
[January 6 - preprinted in diary]
15th 8º above zero clear & dry
16th Lucius Stockwell died
20th took 6 swarms of bees to Dr. Leusas(?); snow storm very cold
21st 5º above zero visited WH Crosby's 
22nd another snow storm
26th - Auditor meeting convenes
28th went to Peoria - staid all night at Mr. Emersons - Carl sick with Diptheria
29th came home - - old Mrs. Camelin died
30th rain storm all day.

Apr. 2nd - Joseph Staker died - annual town meeting - Thomas Cooper elected supervisor - &(I?) town clerk etc.
Apr 10th - Rec'd $4.44 of Mr. Wrench for H.B. Waters - 
10th plowed gardin
11th - sowed onions peas beets rashishes celery etc etc - very high wind from the south
15th snow squalls Ann's birth day - rain last night
May 17th Walter birth day
Grove died
May 21st Judge Bryant died
June 1st fine rain storm - much wanted. Sisters house finished carpenters go
7th great fright - Farm creek swept.  Bridges gone farms(?) gone
17th Great P___ Jubilee - in Boston
18th state sunday school in Aurora
19th very hot 100º in the shade
20th 100º again ...
July 4th celebrated at our Grove oration by Mr. Charles of Peoria - reading declaration by James K. Kellogg
13th went to Peoria - transfered 40 shares stock in 2nd National Bank to my wife Ann - deposited $750, in Bank 9º - preperatory(?) Lecture(?) Eddie Gillum baptised
8th caucus at Morton - 5 delegates to Pekin in the 10 inst 9th very

14th July - 100º plump. Communion to day Edie Gillum joins the church - set letter of ABR
17th great rain storm - all day - from the N.E.
24th finished cutting oats - rain and mud 
25th another rain storm - rain nearly every day - bad harvesting
30th went to Peoria.
Republic call for 20 pt more smoky(?) 60 pr ct $1200 from me
31st again went to Peoria
[January 11]
thunder showers continually - hay spoilt grain damaged - hard for farmers
Aug. 1 1872 - pleasant day - larks singing
2nd F.W. Aubry died - with a whisky jug at his bed side
7th Mr. Emerson and Mrs. Johnson visited here. Aunt Waters dies last week in Peoria - aged 87 years
8th very hot weather 98º
[January 12]
19th Aug. Junius and boys start for home - Charles Ballance Esq. - died an old resident of Peoria
20th Republican convention in Pekin - beautiful day - after a long wet spel
28th Charles Groves died - Barnums great show in Peoria - thunder showers last night
31st went to Pekin - settled up the Republic.

Sept 1st /72 - Mr. Gue from Omaha preached today - beautiful day
10th went to Forpaugh(?) Menagerie - Loell(?) sick
12th rainy - wet time - many sick - Jayshy little girl died - Frank Welbs child died
16th Mr. Ankenny died aged 72 years
22nd N.B. Curtis died thunder shower all day - warm
Mr. Flint and wife here yesterday
Seister(?) sick - John A. some better
23rd still warm - muddy roads
26th Mr. Mucky's chiold died cool wind from N.W. a change in the weather
27th killing frost down to freezing - cut sweet potato vines yesterday just in time. P.S. Shelly died yesterday. very suddenly
28th finished thrashing - rain storm
[January 15]
Equinoctial - day and night
10th put apples into the cellar
11th - 5º below freezing
14th - 6º below freezing
Ambrose S. Wycoff of Jerry Co. died
20th Old Mr. Lawrence died
26th Joel & wife visited here
Nov. 1st husked corn beautiful weather
4th rain storm
14th snow storm turned very cold. started for Galesburg - Junius twins(?) have the whooping cough - 15º cold winters day
16th went to church Rev. Mr.

Taylor preached.  Mr. Basem__(?) preached in the 1B church.
18th came to Peoria - still very cold
19th came home - snow squalls
20th 3º above clear cold winter weather - Barton(?) has about 600 bushels of apples in pens(?) - for cider = they are some frozen.  Old Mrs. Sharpe died over 100 yrs old. Widow Dupore(?) died
20th turned warm
24th warm smoky 
28th Thanksgiving - Mary come home the rest all gone recall to Peoria
29th 5º below zero - sun dogs
30th zero - getting cloudy - wrote a letter to HB Montross
Dec. 1 1872 snow storm. the Horse disease in Peoria - horse cars all stopped - one case of it in Monto__(?)
5th visited Mr. Burhans - Groveland
6th took up $500 Note - horses all have the epyotic. Major Cullom Died.
[January 18]
Rev. N.C. Clark - died in Elgin - Mr. Cyrus Parker Died
9th Birth day - 65 yrs old - 3º above z-
15th W.W. Sellers Editor of the Pekin Republican died
17th Register for election - extremely dry
19th snow storm 5 in deep
21st 8º below zero - very cold - at noon 7º below at bed time 26º below zero.

1873
24th 26º below zero - clear - Deull went to Peoria - several chickens found frozen to death - Edwin Forest died a few days since - 
15th christmas - last night 12º below zero 2º below - wind S.E. last night was presented with a gold pen + case by my A.S. class. David Todd here - getting warmer - cloudy -
27th 12º below zero clear and pleasant. Judge Wm Kellogg died
29th  2º above zero - yesterday killed a Buf (Beef?) - snow squalls all day - Elikus Rogers Died at Bloomington
31st snow storm 8 in - will make good sleighing - Mr. Gibson + Orren Castle here
Jan. 1st 1873 - snow squally - Lester(?) went to Peoria in sleigh
2nd rained all night - all slush - shall have plenty cistern water
5th snow storm again
6th - 10º below zero clear wind S.E.
7th special election - for coroner and sheriff
8th a Norther - snow flying - 4º above - bright sun dogs
9th 8º below
10th 10º below with N.W. wind very severe - on the 4th Just. John Gridley + Henry Riblet died in Pekin
11th preparatory lecture
12th - pleasant communion
13th Jan. thaw
15th snow morty (mostly) gone - heavy rain yesterday

1873
17th Jan 6º below zero - cold again
18th snow squalls - got letter from Ambrose + Jinnius - at 10 minutes to 12 at night Mary Messinger - had a son Born
20th cloudy 4º freezing snow storm
24th N.E. snow storm about 8 in fell
25th 6º below zero
28th 13º below zero cold N.W. wind
30th 33º below zero - beat that if you can
[January 23]
clear and pleasant
Feb. 1st - 18º below 
3rd - rain storm - get to go to Pekin on the Grand Jury - arrived at Pekin after dark
4 jury not full no organization to day. thawed all day put up at the American house
4th pleasant morning jury call at 9 oclock - Ex. Gov. Matteson Died
6th another pleasant day. the jury had a case of Bigamy Black + white mixed
7th came home on foot on the rail road track - pretty tired
8th went to morton(?) paid out $616.00 for Leull(?) - made out a Quit claim deed to Henry Miller of part of church lot for $30.--
10th went to church
11th killed 2 hogs for our meat
15th J. McClay Smith died in Peoria of heart disease.

1873
16th N.E. rain storm - Leull sick last night - trustee meeting
20th Wat Lockwood came here - no money as usual
21st turned cold 4º below zero Leull sick
22nd 8º below zero N.W. wind - too cold to work
24th Zero - Walters move their things on the cars(?)
25th 4º above
26th rain & sleet - dismal day
27th A norther - cold high wind - Walter gone to Austin Herdings(?) - icy
March 1st went to Peoria snow storm - Dr. Leamper(?) died at Chinia
2nd 3 in snow - winter like
3rd - 6º above zero - clear
4th 8º below zero
5th warmer - Charles Waters & wife visited here
6th spring morning
9th Walter & Fannie left here today - most likely I shall never see June any more sad to think of - 
10th James Bradshaw only child died - sick only 10 hours
[January 27]
I have a sever cold - on my lungs
11th pleasant N.W. wind - I am so hoarse I can scarsely speak - Fanny failing - sent a letter to Junius
18th Road com. meeting
25th Auditors meeting - great snow storm - all day - cold wind
26th snow from 6 to 8 in deep - winters morning 
27th 2º above zero clear & pleasant.

[January 28]
30 Mar - snow squalls. cant go to church
Apr. 1 town meeting Wm. R. Barnum died last night
Thomas Casper Sup. J.M. Robert t__(?) clerk the 14th time voted to build a Town house - cold rany day
4th very warm - 86º 
5th 87º hot sultry weather
6th heavy thunder showers all night - grass - look green
7th rained all day Leister(?) had a daughter born at [January] between 11 + 12 oclock P.M.
8th ground white with snow - still snowing - Awful time - rain snow + mud
9th snow squalls - association in Fremont
10th showery
11th rain again
12th clear skye - think it wont rain to day - roads almost impassible - Marc. & Mary - over to Messingers - rain every day
Loaned Lester $20.00 for Mary
[January 30]
Farmers all idle - discouraging 
16th went to Peoria - with Leister - loaned him $5.00 - Marc & Mary start for Galesburg at 2 P.M. - terrible muddy roads - rain again. The Co. Map left here for me
17th Charles Roberts to be married - rain...rain worse than ever - Com. meet in Morton - rains to hard for me to go

1873
21st Wind from NE very cold
22nd went to Washington - very cold
23rd Leister began sowing oats - a little snow fell last night
24th ground white with snow - winter again - yesterday went after the Dr. for John A. Erastus sick made garden
25th planted potatoes
26th finished sowing oats - cold winds
27th wind N.E. cold grass cant grow
28th rained all night - + mist + rain all day - from N.E.  Homer Roberts Died Apr. 18th
30th helpt John A. fix fine(?) on his farm - looks like rain(?)
May 1st another rainy day - bad for farmers. Mary Ann Campbell married at 7 oclock to A.M. a wet time of it
Let John A. have $100 to pay for his wagon
2nd misty rainy all day - discouraging for farmers
Dr. Rouse died.
7th Fannie Roberts died at 4 oclock PM
9th very heavy rain - everything afloat - Fannie buried - grave had to bailed out - awful
10th Com. meeting
11th heavy shower last night again = Farmers discouraged
18th rain - nothing but rain Lester planted corn the 17th
19th rain-rain Lester gone to Pekin.

[February 1]
on Petit Jury - got discharged no court this week
21st went up to plow - rain & thunder drove us back - what shall we do
23rd rain every day and night
24 ___
26th thunder showers every day - Many farmers have not planted any yet - no end to in. Mr. Guc preached to us yesterday
31st finished planting corn for John A.
1st June - pleasant dry communion day
[February 2]
5th Nancis and children come on the train from Chinoa
7th went to Peoria for Clarisse Smith and daughter Malvina - making 7 visitors
9th went to Groveland with cousins visiting - thunder showers got wet
10th paid Leulls last note of 500 dollars
14th Lester paid me $15.00 - 10.00 due - showers - hot 93º Junnius and family here - Clarissa went to Peoria yesterday - 17th anniversary of the battle of Bunkerhill - and the discovery of the Mississippi river
18th took Junius & family to Peoria - very hot weather - commenced haying on the bottom of Farm creek - Charlie planting corn
24th attended Mr. Anson Gillums 80th birth day Party - 100º - expensive to Rock Island for $3.00 round trip.

1873
25th 104º awful hot weather - want rain - Erastus youngest child has the measles - fine rain - good Rec'd letter from ABR - with 10. dollars
28th summoned on Jury at Groveland - on road damage - awarded Berg(?) OBrien $445 - and Forlman(?) $4.00 - school pic nic at OBriens Grove = the contract let to Mr. Claib for building Town house at $875 to be completed by the middle of August
[February 5]
29th heavy tunder shower - hail & high wind - went to church
30th cool wind clear and pleasant - growing time - sent letter to A.B.R.
1st July - rainy all day - muddy
2nd rain in forenoon - roads muddy. Mahlon Welcher died day before yest.
5th rain - rain every other day - bad haying
6th thunder & rain - 
7th another rainy day - every other day rain, rain
11th began haying
13th heavy rain with thunder & lightning
16th 104º in shade
18th cooler finished haying
21st visited J.W. Clocks
22nd went to the Fair grounds. Morning(?) Men at work then - went into the country
23rd Sent certificates of tax assessments to the County Clerk
30th finished harvesting oats
31st fine rain storm - much needed.

[February 7]
Telegraphy
179,294 miles of operating lines and 6,565 offices
Deepest Soundings in the Pacific Ocean 4575 fathoms or 27450
[February 8]
"She said that that that that that woman used was not the that that that woman should have used."
Cure for Small Pox & Scarlet Fever
Sulphate of Zinc one gr. - Fiox Glove one grain - 1 tea spoon of sugar mix with 2 tea spoons water when thoroughly mixed add 4 oz of water - take a tea spoon full every hour - Either disease will disappear in 12 hours - for a child smaller doses according to age.

Goat   10  Hen  10

[February 13]
Nov. 4th 1873
David Keys Elected Co. Judge
R.D. Smith   "   Co. Clerk
Thos. Cooper    "  "  Treasurer

      Porufort(?)  "   "  Superintendent


Counterfits
refuse all 5s on the
[February 14]
1st National Bank Chicago Ills
1st    "           "     Paxton      "
1st      "        "       Canton     "
1st      "         "  Aurora           "
1st      "        "   Galena     "

  Traders  "  "  Chicago     "

[February 15]
Cholera Medium(?)
Equal parts of tincture opium red pepper - rhubarb - peppermint - and camphor - does from 3 to 10 drops for a child - 10 - 30 drops to adult according to severity of attack

[February 16]
At San Francisco the needle points 17º east of North. At Calais Me. as much west at San Frances the needle dips 63º
Highest Mountain in the World
Mount Hercules in New Guinea
32,786 feet - being 3000 ft higher than Mt. Everest
Sea of Gallilee  700 600 ft below the Mediterranean Sea
[February 17]
The Dead Sea - is the lowest body of water on the Globe
1320 ft. below ocean level
Bromium - potassium + other salts every gallon contains 3 lbs of pure salt
8130 Newspapers published in the U.S.A. in 1876
[February 18]
Berj(?) OBrien - Artisian well is 1442 feet deep  150 ft down to water a failure
Largest Gun in the Worls at Spizzia  100 ton Ball 2000 lb 330 lb powder
Sure Cure of Small Pox
1 oz cream of tartar dissolved in 1 pt water drank at interval when cold - Edward Hiru of Liverpool says

[February 19]
John Ali - was to start for Onarga - to day - drew(?) writings between Erastus and his Mother - E.G. Emerson - hire - to day
Aug. 1 1873 Beautiful day Ann went to Peoria with Erastus & Augusta - roads some muddy
4th 48º cold and clear
13th finished stacking oats
14th Barnums great show dry + dusty want rain very much
22nd Began watering cattle extremely dry & dusty
31st hot - 102º high wind extremely dry - seems there must be a change R.R. brack lard up to the wagon road - will be in Morton this week at 3 oclock still at 102º --Oh Dear 4,15 oclock over 100º yet
Rev. Darius Gore died at La Hoga
Sept. 2nd audition(?) meeting - the cars crossed our public road towards Morton - Lester had his thrashing done - 221-1/2 bu oats 
3rd a little rain - hope for more
5th rain - cooler
10th Pembroke Mr. Main - brot here to be taken care of - was cut in the calf of leg - to the bone
13th fine rain
15th state fair opens in Peoria - boys began fall plowing.

1873
19th Sept - State Fair - went to it - cool morning - great show
20th killing frost - down to freezing - sent a card to Mary
22nd WB Parker died in Pekin Widow Harvey died in Peoria - great fire in Burlington
24th An Italian R.R. hand died and was buried in paupers lot
Equinotial rain storm - glad to see Gen. E.D. McCook of Pekin was
[February 23]
assassinated died yankten(?)
27th farmers meeting - delegates to Pekin Banks all closed - a Panic
28th Rain storm - good thankful
30th started for Galesburg
Oct. 1st left Galesburg for Burlington
2 - wrint(?) Augustus Burhan cloudy day
3d at 7.20 oclock start west for Osciola arrived at Mary's at 3oclock found them well - rainy day - took a  Bus. etc. cloudy and misty - sent a card to Leull
5 attended Presbyterian Church
6 froze - started for Viliska at 10 oclock arrived at Murray at 11 oclock at Thayer 12 oclock 1 oclock at Afton at Creaton 1.40  Cromwell 2.30 oclock Prescott 3 oclock Corning 3.30 oclock Brooks 4.10 Nadaway 4.30

Valisca 5.0 met Rinz's (?) pursuaded him to go back with me - walked 7 miles to Warrens
7th Warren took us to Brother Ambrose
8th we went to Daniel's took dinner then went home by the way of Hawlysville
9th James took us to Brookville - in time for the cars - got back to Osceola took a ride around the country
10th smoky - Indian summer at 9 oclock evening started back for Galesburg - arrived at 7 oclock on the 11th
12 went to church heard Mr. Williston preach in the evening heard Mr. Hazen missionary from Bombay India
13 Rinzi started for Peoria called at Mr. Frank Colton and saw many beautiful paintings both ancient and modern besides other curiosities - from all parts of the world
14th got home
15th clear and very dry
17th rainy day - Harry Wolus gone to Peoria - wrote to letter to Clarissa Smith
19th cold freezing went to church
20 4º below freezing
27th first snow flakes - winter
28th ground white with snow - still snowing
29th 13º above zero 
30th 18º above

David Keys Co. Judge
Treasurere Thos.Cooper
R.D. Smith " Clerk
[February 28]
Pomfrit
Nov. 1st 1873 - 14º above zero - winter weather - clear sky but cold
4th election Co. Judge Clerk Treasuere and school superintendent  - beautiful day
5th Co. Kerr died of gun shot - accidental
6th Frank Webb's child died - Lester finished gathering corn
7th pulled turnips
8th visited Alfred Dian - Fremont - Cynthia Curtis Died (72?)
12th snow squalls visited Robert Roberts
12th 17º above zero cloudy - went to Groveland - with Lester
14th 9º above zero - winter certain
15th preparation Lecture have a lame back - wrote to Mindwell Daytin Sycamore
18th snow storm last night - ground white with snow
19th 6º above zero - clear and cold
23rd great rain storms from the N.E. sunday - cant go to church
24th ground white with snow
26th Cousin Belton Pehlps from N.Y. visits us
26th - Lester plowing - high wind looks like storm
27th Thanksgiving day cold and windy N.W. wind - invited Mr. Leake(Dake?) & wife + Augusta to supper
28th 7º above zero - clear - Killed a hog. George Stackwell died a few days since
30th went to Church - cool
Mr. Allison in Peoria died
3d heavy rain after 3 days misty Gov. Yates died
7th 3 in. snow fell last night - warm and misty - crust on snow
9th Birth day - Brothers all gone so I

1874 [March 1]
had no Birth day party - the first time for over 20 years.
10th - Rain storm again 
11th Leull's Birth Day as well as Junius - Leull 20 yrs Junius 40 yrs - rained all night - a real flood - water comes into the cellars
12th rained all night - everything afloat
rain steady 2 nights and a day - water in my cellar - 3 in. deep - wind north - will turn cold soon
[March 2]
12th Rec'd a letter from Mary - they are thrown out of employment and have to come back to Morton misty all day
13th snow fall 2 or 3 in. deep last nigh - winter like now
15th 16º below freezing - clear. sent letters to Boston - for Youth Compass & Harpers Weekly - Leull gone to Peoria
20th 10º above - visited at Mr. Lake
21st 8º above - very rough roads
[March 3]
24th warm & pleasant
January 1st 1874
invited to dinner at Mr. Les. S. Lake
2nd rec'd Registered letter from Bilton Phelps with $15.00 - very foggy all day and muddy - Expect Marc. & Mary tomorrow - they start at 10 oclock for Osceola tonight
3d in the morning within 4º of (impact?)(Temperature?) high wind from the south - awful roads

[March 4]
Jan 5th 4º below zero - and impassible roads - crust and break through - Mr. Miller starts home - in Ohio
11th cold N.W. wind have had a lame back for nearly a week - and am unwell otherwise so I am confined to the house
13th Watson Lockwood here no money again
14th 3º below zero - very cold
15th 10º below - clear - Marc. & Mary
[March 5]
move home to day - my back still weak
19th sent a letter to A.B.R. misty yesterday wet and muddy to day - Paid taxes $7.32
20th snow storm - per S.E 
21st rain all day
22nd heavy rain all night - and still raining - the 5th day of storm
23d clear at last - boys went to Peoria
24th A. Texas Norther - ground white with snow - 2º above zero - clear skies
21st sent letter to W.B.R. warn _____ Mary sick
29th pleasant day. Ann taken sick with chill & fever
1st Feb. snow storm all day - Frank here - goes to Onargo tomorrow - N.E. wind
10th Robert and Thomas Roberts & families on a visit
11th Lester + Ann gone to Peoria - warm spring weather - Deacon Moses(?) Morse died
14th St. Valentine - Farmers meeting at Morton - very muddy - frost nearly all out

[March 7]
cold snap last monday the 8th - thermometer at Lancaster N.H. stood at 46º below zero Concord 32º below Island Pond Me. 36º below Lewiston 28º August frm 24º to 33º Franklin 30º Meredith Village 32º etc etc
16th warm spring day - bluebirds come
21st N.E. stow storm
25th went to Peoria - visited Emerson and J.W. Clark
26th drew money from Bank - cam home
27th 
[March 8]
pleasant weather - cut wood etc
Mar. 1st foggy misty - wrote letters to Junius and Horace L. Storrs - but 9 at church
2d still foggy
4th sent letters to WB Roberts - Betsy Ann & Harpus Wulsy(?) last night heavy thunder shower with hail - this morning ground white with snow
6th thunder showers - Abraham Chaffer died
\7th a real Norther - blew ___(trees? fences?) down
8th cold windy clear day sundogs
[March 9]
15th Sunday - misty - another bad church day - roads getting passible - Millard Fillmore died - only one Ex. President Alive - Andy Johnson - Robert Hodges died last friday 
16th Erastus takes hogs to Peoria - misty & showery - Charles Sumner Died - a Senator in Congress
21st some making gardens - Joseph Staker died this morning

1874
[March 10]
24th Mar. Com. of highways meeting cold wind 12º above zero Old Mrs. Reed Died
25th rainy - cut out Raspberry canes - Lull hauling wood
26th went to Peoria Deposited $800 in Bank - cold wind
27th snow squalls - plowed(?) garden
28th Mrs. Cynthia Mooberry Died - Junius came here
30th Took Junius to the bridge
31st Auditors meeting - snow storm - winter in 
[March 11]
earnest
Apr. 1st 14º above zero - clear
4th visited Mary Messenger - cold NE wind Election of school Director J.C. May reelected
5th Great Snow storm - at 1 oclock 9 in deep and still snowing
6th 12º above zero winters fog
7th Town meeting elected again Town Clerk the 15th time - Erastus Moderator - mass thawing
9th cold N.E. wind ground frozen hard - snow still to be seen
11th Motified Board to appoint Com. pleasant in the morning wind shifted in to the N.E. and turned very cold
12th snow not all gone yet
13th sowed oats - very high wind
14th heavy thunder showers last night - warmer to day 
15th Ann's Birth day 55 yrs old.
16th NE snow storm winter like
16th Mrs. Sam'l C. Smith died of consumption
18th sowed grass seed

1874
[March 13]
19th another NE rain storm wrote letters to Walter & Ambrose
20th thunder showers last night - rainy day again - last friday Mary Wing died - 2 weeks ago Mrs. John Norris Died
22nd Mr. John Flanckin died - muddy roads
23d Deacon Clark Died last night - Lull sick yet - 2º below freezing - this morning - last monday Willard Gray Died
24th [March 14]
buried at Gridley - today Funeral of Deacon Clark - cold this morning 6º below freezing
25 Road Com. meeting - showery
26th pleasant day
27th rain storm again - discouraging time for farmers
28th ground white with snow - winter like in New York state - yesterday snow fell 2 ft deep
30th went to Pekin got Blanks
May 1st - took potatoes out of the cellar - Judge Daniel D. Lockwood Died
2d cold NE wind
3d NE rain storm again discouraging time for farmers
7th Mr. Lake starts for Ohio - Mary Landis had a runaway - thrown out of Buggy - took Mrs. Lantis home - pleasant day - farmers encouraged now
9th delivered road papers(?) to 11 _______
11th showery - growing time
14th Jonathan?Trenton? Byrn planting corn showery - thunder showers.

1874
[March 16]
15th very growing time - boys planting corn - first Cuckoo singing
16th rainy - again
17th heavy rain - no end to rain - mud + water every thing in bloom - growing time - Walter's birth day - I am under the weather for a week past
24th hot day 91º
25th Lester shelled corn
28th started for Onarga - arrived there at 6 oclock walked from Golmore to Onarga on the Central track which is covered with broken stone - found Brother Walter better
[March 17]
29th rode out to Caleb Hardings & Charles Cornwells very level country
30th visited the Country - and the fair ground saw 10 imported Norman Horses
31st went to the Methodist church - extreme hot weather great attention to small fruit over 300 acres to strawberries one mane will have 250 bu of raspberries
31st eat some ripe strawberries - went to church
1st June turned cold - rode to Gilman's had to wait till 11:48 for the train - walked home from Washington - paid HWC our $7.25
2nd fine rain - growing time
3d festival to night
4th + 5th thunder showers
7th Col. Wm. Lackland Died from a fall on a wagon
8th Rep. caucas to Pekin on the 10th
9th thunder showers
10th thunder showers again - cooler
13th visited Peoria
14th sent letter to Clarissa
15th rainy misty day

[March 19]
20th June - very hot - James Roberts has been here - 99º want rain
25th thunder shower
26th hot hot - Mr. Roberts staid all night
28th Brother Smith preached at the town Hall - very hot & dry
29th Board - corrected assessments Roll - great want of rain
1st July hot dry day(?)
2nd swarm bees out - great want of rain
[March 20]
4th pic nic in our grove - hot 102º
6th harvesting - every day over 100º - what are we coming to - the sky is brazen - at 3oclock 106º that will I never knew the likes Oh! dear dear
7th Lester cut his wheat 101º - appearance of rain
8th a splendid rain - how rejoiced we are - our sorrow turned to joy & thankfulness.
11th cook NE wind - hauling in hay - Mrs. Fenner of Fremont died.  Mr. T.C. Moore of Peoria died - 56º
12th 58º
16th cool 60º great want of rain - pastures all drying up
20th hot and dry
25th pastures all dryed up - have to water cattle 102º Oh! Dear we shall all burn up
26th the warmest night I ever knew - what will become of us --- 100º again

1874
[March]
July 29th - paid Dr. Bill $3.00 Ann sick. Neuraligan(?) dry as cork(?)
Aug 1st a little shower last night - thankful for a little
Aug. 5th a splendid rain storm what we have been wanting for a long time - sent a card to Junius
9th Aug. Frank Moobury Died of Cholera
10th Lester thrashed his grain(?) very hot 102º - rec'd a card from Junius
[March 23]
sent letter to John T. Gibson
13th went to Peoria - got 410 dollars for J.W.C. deposited in 2nd National Bank
19th sent card to Fannie - hot + dry as ever - stock water getting scarsion(?)
18th Junius & family visiting here on their way to Indianapolis
21 digging the well  deeper hot + dry
22nd thunder shower gladly received
23rd cooler had a splendid rain
24th took Junius + family to Fremont - on their way to Bloomington and Indianapolis
25th went to Peoria loaned John T. Gibson $1000.00 Borrowed $500 of J.W. Clark - horse taken sick had to stay over night
26th came home looks like rain
27th splendid rain storm
28 rain all day
29th heavy thunder showers cisterns getting full Old Mr. Christ. White Died in Kansas a few days ago.

1874
Sept. 1st Auditors meeting - sent Reg. letter to W.B. Roberts Onarga - warm + pleasant
4th heavy thunder showers - plenty of rain now
6th cool clear day - Bible meeting Mrs. Charlie Pratt died yesterday
9th went to Mitamora - chancelled 2 mortgages of Schrmbly's(?)
10th Old Setters union in Central Park Peoria - Mr. Dixon from Dixon Ills present nearly 90 years old. was the first Co. Clerk & Runder(founder?) of Peoria Co. had of pleasant time
14th State Fair opened - looks like rain
15th splendid rain dust now laid - cool Wm. E. Parker Lawyer of Pekin died by cutting his own throat - delerium tremens.
[March 27]
16th went to State Fair - got my pocket picked of $15.25 - many others lost money & watches
19th built Lulls chimney - cool
20 43º nearly a frost
23d - let Mollie have $40.00 - got a card from Junius
25th rain storm - Lester gone to Peoria with oats 
30th digging well for John A.

Oct. 1st 7º above freezing - walling John A. well
5th Old Mr. Kicker died
5th a little rain last night
9th picked apples for winter use - great want of rain - wells going dry
12th killing frost 1º below freezing
13th 10º below freezing - every thing killed now - leaves falling fast - John Birket Died in Peoria
24th misty - finished digging potatoes yesterday
27th showers want more
[March 29] went to Groveland - Henry A. Smith spoke - on politics
28th Hiram Phillip speaks in Morton - after which an oyster suppe - warm weather
29th thunder showers last night - turned cold
30th snow squalls - Lull digging potatoes
31st ground white with snow
1st Nov. clear & cold 6º below freezing - NW wind
13th 15º above zero - still dry a ever
[March 30]
14th Rain storm - Com. of Morton & Fremont met at Mr. Bright and settled the controversy - of Road alloted the division.  ___
16th another rain storm every body rejoicing cattle and all
18th oyster supper at town hall
19th Lester sold his hogs at 1-1/4 after noon snow storm Ann and Lull went to Peoria.

Nov. 20 - snow 3 in deep - still snowing Lester killed a hog - for meat 
23d - snow squally - went to Pekin on the Petit jury - set up all night. verdict at 8 oclock next day
24th discharged at 12 and came home
25th clear and cold 9º above zero
27th snow storm - 8 in deep  Mrs. Shreives(?) died
28th good sleighing - 
31 snow storm again.   First regular train on the Midland Railway 7.30 AM
Dec. 1 1874 - foggy good sleighing
2d warm - snow going off 48º
4th warm
10th went to Peoria set Post Office order for Harpers weekly + faith(or youth?) companion - called on S.G. Minkler and old acquaintance at the Horbenthal(?) state meeting.  Enoch Emerson very low - cant live long - Lull brought his Buggy home
16th rain storm - Wells yet dry. Mr. Beri died. Mrs. Jane Berry Died - Samuel Woods___ died
22nd snow fell last night - 2 in. - Erastus kills hogs

- Wot. Lockwood here yesterday

25th Christmas - clear wind S.E. at home Lull hunting - Lester - At Dodds
Yesterday the 24th Brothers Walter B. Roberts & Enoch Emerson both Died.

1875
[April 1]
25 - Ann Lull and I went to Peoria
26th attended Mr. Emersons funeral - he was buried at the Cemetery last evening. Walter was brought to Morton
27th funeral services at the Church
28th Lester + wife start for Indianapolis - roads very muddy
Jan. 1st 1875 - cloudy - snow flakes. mist & Ann and I have severe colds.  Last evening 3 weddings - Mattie Crandall vs. Charles McClellen, G.W. Griffin + Ms. Jenks - Charles Mooberry + Mis Lucy Scott
3d Zero
4th 1º below - clear - Frank starts for Onarga
5th 10º below - clear NW wind
9th 23º below 2 RR men staid all night at noon 8º below and began to sink
10th 16º below - wind S.E. 
11th 8º below
11th 4 RR men staid with us
1_th turned very cold. Boarders left
14th 10º below.  Mr. Roberts here - protracted meeting
15th 6º below wind S.E.
[April 3]
Mrs. Wm. E. Mason Died in Peoria
17th still cold and great want of stock water - Frank Grisson dangerously sick - Frank Griesser Died last night
20th turned warmer after a long spell of severe cold weather
21st beautiful day water very scarce the by cistern only 2 ft of water in it
25th still extremely dry & cold. Stock suffering for want
30th sent 185 dollars to H.B. Waters snow storm 1 in deep good(?)

1875
[April 4]
Feb. 1st clear & cold.
2nd rain storm - the most for a long time
3d Terrible Norther - air full of frost high wind. Thermometer going down
4th 12º below zero - and high wind awful cold
5th 4º below - wind S.E.
7th 10º below
8th 4º below - ____ Deeds for Erastus & Lull rec'd 155. dollars from Gibson
9th 12º below - clear - visited school
10th Great snow storm - 9 in deep
11th - 7º below zero - clear wind NW
12th snow storm - 3-1/2 in. at two oclock this morning 15º below zero
13th 5º 
14th 0º
15th 23º below zero - clear sky
16th 23º again below Terrible cold
17th 4º below. Mr. Ely sick went to Morton
18th 22º below - awful cold
20th yesterday paid taxes went to Groveland warm to day let Lull have 7.15 cts to pay taxes
22nd showery - thunder showers looks like breaking up
23rd rain, rain
24th thunder showers last night, wind NW 2º above freezing
28th cold SE wind storm hail
March 1st rain + hail all night - icy wet dreary
3rd clear 1º above zero - splendid sleighing
3rd great snow storm from N.E. Cars(? - i.e. train?) got slapped (stopped?) by snow here 5 or six in deep - last night before 12 oclock Erastus had his 4th girl born. Mrs. William Lockwood died
4th 0º clear & pleasant - but cold - trains nearly block by ise(ice) + snow

Mar. 5th - Erastus Baby died last night snow again. Last Tuesday Mr. Corwin Died of Palsy + old Mrs. Walker died
7th clear + pleasant 10º above zero
8th 2º above - clear
10th 8º above
12th spring weather - pleanty of snow yet - protracted meeting this week
13th warm spring weather 54º snow going off
14th spring birds - ducks + geese - mud + water 70º in afternoon - Wesley Scott died and buried today - [April 8] snow fast disappearing great Melior[Meteor] in near West Liberty, Muscatine Co. Iowa - it sank 15 ft in the ground and left a hole that depth 10ft in diameter - it shook the earth for miles around about the 1st of March 1875
16th Texas norther cold 11º above zero - snow squalls all day
17th 4º above clear & pleasant 
18th great snow storm. Merion married off his last daughter
[April 9]
19th another snow storm. Train blocked
20th snow squalls
21st do snow snow
22nd 7º above zero - clear
23rd Com. Meeting - lots of snow on ground
25th a Robbery in Morton last night - Wm. Vodpel's(?) safe blown open and $250 stolen the Depot broke open etc.
26th thunder showers last night - spring weather to day

1875
April 1st
High wind roads drying up fast. Isaac Underhill Died a short time ago in Texas - formerly lived in Peoria
8th heavy thunder shower Mrs. Sam'l Lane Died
10th began sowing oats
13th rode over the town notifying overseers
14th ground white with snow Mrs. Fred Leonard died very suddenly - looks like rain
16th 12º below freezing - snow squalls
17th 16º above zero - ground solid ice etc
20th went to Pekin to get Blanks - very cold wind - James McClintock died
21st went to Peoria on Train
22nd came home a little warmer
24th Celia West Died - Com. meeting - Election of trustee
27th JW Clark & wife visited here
28th Lull began planting corn - still extremely dry & cold. nothing grows
29th fine rain. Thankfull all
1st May - big rain. cistern full
2nd 5º below freezing - ice 3/8 in ground solid
3d - rainy day - growing time
4th pleasant - Mary & children here
4th another rainy day
6th heavy frost - went to Peoria to 2nd National Bank paid JW Clark 500 dollars
7th warm growing time - Lull finished

plowing for corn
1875
[April 13]
8th May finished the Road papers - Lester finished plowing - Erastus planting corn
9th rain storm
11th rain every day
15th sent letter to Jewell & Gibson - boys finished planting corn - cold wind from the N.E.
16th ice in the trough 2º above freezing - cold cold weather
18th went to Peoria - dusty
21st splendid rain - very opportive(?) - Ann loaned Lester $70 to go to Galesburg to buy a Ayrshire Butt (Bull?)
23rd showery a growing time
24th  set out Sweet Potatoes - fine growing time
26th 94º Lester got his Ayrshire home
28th big rain  growing time
29th Old Mrs. Phillips Died and was buried at Buck Eye
1st June - thunder showers in many places.  The Holiness people are having a protracted meeting in Morton.
3d the Corner stone laid for Chamber of commerce in Peoria - great procession beautiful day
4th looks like storms
8th went to Peoria - to loan 1000 to Gibson
9th rainy day
13th 12º above freezing Charles Roberts had a boy & girl Twins born Thursday last
14th heavy thunder showers all night
15th rainy weather growing time
16th visited Groveland
17th thunder showers

[April 16]
20th beautiful day - went to Church
21st heavy thunder showers
24th dreadful thunder shower with wind - it blew off the chimney off the Church -
25th distant(?) thunder
1st July - Ref. E.G. Smith & Roberts here
2nd heavy rain storm all night - Willis Roberts came here this morning
3d rain every day
4th July clear and beautifu - an excursion to Peoria from below on the Midland R.R.
5th Thunder showers - last night, rain, rain etc.
9th looks like rain again - Lester cut the Rye - yesterday Mr. E.G. Smith & J.K.Kellogg were here - left subscription papers with me to give to local Agents
14th began haying - 95º light showers - corn taselling out - thunder shower
15th hot 95º got in hay
17th last night constant lightning - heavy rain +wind shower after shower - a blaze all the time
18th rain all night - heavy thunder
[April 18]
19th & 20th misty
20th Mr. McFadden of Peoria died. Gen. Frank P. Blair died a short time ago.
26th thunder showers last night - Began cutting oats - showers
27th showery - bad time for harvesting
28th terrible heavy rain - discouraging for farmers - getting their oats saved - rain all day and night. Oh Dear??
31st NE rain storm - no end to rain farmers look Blue

1875
[April 19]
Aug 1st - the greatest storm of the season rained constantly since yesterday morning corn blown down horridly cold wind 6º below temperate(?)
6th visited Rev. Mr. Roberts oats not half harvested - shelling out. some grass not cut. seed shelled out - Andy Johnson Died a few days ago - Tyler Goor(?) not expected to live
9th went to Groveland after Clarissa
10th heavy thunder showers - began thrashing in the neighborhood
14th very heavy thunder shower
15th Alex. Caldwell died - of flux(?)
18th finished stacking grain - still raining every day - Rev. Charles G. Finney Died of Oberlin Ohio
22nd 13º above freezing - clear & cold
23d - 44 years ago we arrived at our home in Illinois
[April 21] went to Groveland and drew Drodarna's(?) will
29th rain storm last night
30th Lester thrashed his wheat and oats
31st John A. has his thashing done - put it off for several weeks
1st Sept - boys gone to Peoria with oats - Dr.s Harris + Shirtleff(?) and folks called here - Ann sick very hot with
2nd awful tempestuous night 4 or 5 in of rain fell. terrible thunder.

Dr. Sheppard died was drowned in crossing the creek at Colis
5th warm
7th auditors meeting
8th 90º warm
9th great rain storm last night thunder etc.
10th Terrible tempest last night
13th went to Peoria - staid all night at Mrs. Emersons - at 7 A.M. started for Indianapolis arrived at 4.10 Junius + Willie met us rode to Junius house 195 Christan(?) Avenue
14th OKCoe went with me to the largest Pork(Park?) in the U.States
15th went to Methodist Conference saw Bishop Foster they ordained 11 new Ministers - Great Industrial Processiong from 4 to 5 miles long 1-1/2 hour passing
18th went to the market & Matinee - saw Indian relics - stone hatchets axes arrows etc etc
16th Reception by Gov. Hendricks of the Odd fellow of the U.S.A. Senator Morton [April 24] Schyler Coffey(?) and other notables - moir(?) sphu_bus(?)
20th went to to the Country and the exposition - saw a painting of the  battle of Lookout Mountain by Walker 32 x 15 ft Gen. Hooker the central figure
23rd returned home to Peoria
24th got home again there has been only a slight frost.

[April 25]
Tyler Gove died
Nancy (Sloan) Plum died  - sent letter to Gibson & Juius - Jacob Tapping Died in Peoria
29th Mr. Crosby & son John(?) Deare(?) etc. visited here. Let Lull have $25.00 Dug Sweet Potatoes
30th rain storm - Sale at Coldwell
1st Oct. Lull's Thrashing to day
2nd First killing frost
5th very heavy thunder & rain [April 26] bad for the fair at Peoria
6th rain all night - with thunder etc. still raining - sent letter to Sycamore - bad weather for the Fair
9th gathered in winter apples
10th rainy day
11th 4º below freezing
12th - 6º below freezing. Began gathering cider apples
13th cousins from Sycamore came here
14th finished gathering apples - rainy - cold
21st warm 72º beautiful weather killed a hog - Harriet went home. George Spurick(?) died. Also Charles P. Tagart Died. in Cal. 
22nd 76º hot took cousins to Groveland
25th took Cousins to Washington - Thunder and rainy
26th cooler cloudy
29th went to Peoria - sent a Draft of $108 to HBWaters - extremely warm - on our way home heavy hail storm & rain - snow in Chicago
1st Nov. 2º below freezing - smoky
3d Mr. Robt. Watts died
7th Old Mrs. Sally Brown died

1875
[April 28]
12th Nov. warm beautiful weather Erastus took his hogs to Peoria at 7 cts per lb.
13th first snow
15th sent letters to ABR + JBR
16th Ground white with snow 11º below freezing
17th 12 above zero - clear - 
21st - 12º above zero very keen wind. clear. Corn________
22nd Vice President Wilson Died
25th Thanksgiving day - south wind pleasant children at home - roast turkey etc.
26th rain all night. Lester delivered his hogs in Morton 18 in all - cloudy all day
[April 29]
29th 7º above zero - clear - Lull went to Peoria with a load of corn
1st Dec. clear warm beautiful day - the Grangers draw writings to day - Ann & Mary visited JB Sell's
4th misty all yesterday & to day - yesterday Mr. AWStewart Died
5th still foggy & misty
6th another rainy foggy day
7th still rainy & foggy the 5th day
8th still stormy -ground white with snow
9th still cloudy - ground white - Birth day sent for Harpers Weekly & Youth Companion
10th snow squalls
11th snow squalls again - stormy every day for 10 days
16th snow squalls - turned cold
17th 5º below zero - clear - very cold all day
20th Grangers goods came to Morton - warm
21st Lester takes 1 doz. Turkies & I doz. of chickens to Peoria - warm & showery
22nd clear warm spring day
24th warm and showery - like April
25th Christmas 3º below freezing - beautiful day - party at Lesters
26th rain storm.

27th cold - 12º below freezing - very rough
28th killed 3 hogs - up to 40º
29th stormy
30th still warm + misty S wind
31st - very warm & showery 68º at noon.  Hon. W.A. Richardson Died Dec. 27th
1st Jan. 1876 heavy rain last night - warm this morning 58º all mud & water
5th pleasant - 
6th still warm & pleasant - roads nearly impassable upt to 50º - Gully was up(?)
9th Thunder showers last night this morning warm and rainy - at noon wind changed  A Norther from 50º down to below freezing in a short time [May 2] at 2 oclock going down rapidly
10th 8º above zero
13th went to Groveland to mill 2º below zero
14th warm sun shine day
16th foggy and rainy - mud etc
18th Vic's birth day 3 yrs old rainy day - 54º awful roads O? dear
22nd misty + muddy - 2 movers wagons passing - foggy. J.A. Flanigan Died. Mrs. G.C. Baston died. Mrs. Andy Johnson Died
27th mass meeting for Bridge went to Peoria [May 3] awful roads - rain twice a week all the time - the oldest inhabitant never saw the like 62º at noon
29th a mild Norther 7º above
31st beautiful day - walked to Washington and back - got very tired.
Feb. 1st - snow squalls all day - turning cold - Nat Brown left here this morning
2nd 3º below zero
3d snow storm
4th 5º below
8 went to Peoria get a certificate for $250 - very pleasant day
7th rain storm

1876
[May 4]
9th thunder showers road impassible no winter this year
10th thunder showers 62º spring like
13th sunday - thunder storm etc etc etc
17th for several days pleasant winter weather - Boys breaking corn stalks - road terrible rough - R_rrly Johnson died
21st rain storm cleared off cool
25th Erastus Roberts & family moved to Morton beautiful spring day - Ann & Lull gone to Peoria [May 5] George W. Fridley Died at El Paso Richard Woodrow Died at Green Valley
27th thunder showers - Charles Waters visited here yesterday
29th Feb. clear & cool. Lull began painting the house
1st March 1876 - Great snow storm 6 in deep.
2nd good sleighing. Lester gone/goes to Peoria on a sleigh - after noon rode to Peoria got a draft we Change(?) for Haynes Jesden & Co.
3d 7º above zero
5th snow all gone
6th warm showery 68º 
8th went to Peoria deposited $900 in Savings Bank
10th 74º Monsters(?) showers
11th last night heavy thunder showers all night
13th rec'd letter from Ambrose
14th sent letter to ABR - cold E wind
15th another rain storm Oh? when shall we get passible roads
16th Equinoctial storm - water came into the cellar
17th squally(?) all day - makes 3 days storm already

[May 7]
Mar. 18th 7º above zero - clear after a 3 days storm - Lester started for W. Dodds but had to come back - for impassible roads
20th snow squalls all day
23rd 1 in snow last night
24th great rain storm cold N.E.
27th looks like storm again
28th Auditors meeting - greatest snow storm of the season - Town offices could not together - snowed all & blew the snow into drifs - so that Trains were blocked in snow somewhere about 7 or 8 in - drifs as high as the fences - the roads about 12 in deep of mud at the bottom of the snow
29th clear and pleasant 16º below freezing - Auditors met
30th trains get through to day - cool and sun shiny
31st pleasant snow thawing off at Watnka(?) snow fell 2 ft
1st Apr. awful cold sleety rain storm - every body in Town & country are disheartened - every body blue Oh Dear!!!!
[May 9]
4th Town meeting - pleasant weather encouraging
6th notified overseers went on foot - walked 1/2 mile on snow banks 3 ft deep
7th farmers encouraged - prospect of fair weather John Hamlin Died on the 5th ___ last night collision on THW & Medil__(?)  Old Mrs. Hampton Died in Morton
9th another beautiful day - also 10th sowed onion seeds plowed out garden
13th heavy thunder showers, grass green

[May 10]
12th Apr. 1876 thunder showers around 72º very hot
13th heavy thunder showers all night - now showery - Farmers are getting discouraged - Augusta came home last night - Miss Anderson died and was buried in our cemetery to day. Mr. Milligan Died a few days since. A. T. Steward Died the great NY merchant. Mrs. Ben. B___(?) died - Mrs. W.T. Dowdall Died
14th Turned cool. snow flakes glad to see [May 11] clear skye again
15th Ann's birth day 58 yrs old had a party invite. pleasant day. Old Mrs. Humphrey Died
17th Lull's mare has a cold. cool N Wind
18th went to Pekin by way of Peoria - river high - some frms(?) plowing - for Road Blanks etc.
19th Boys began sowing oats 22º Corn. Meeting Burglarry at Dry/Drug store in Morton
24th commenced making out Road papers [May 12] pleasant weather but cool cattle can live on grass 
29th Fanny came here from Onarga
30th cold wind went to Church
1st May at freezing - very cold wind - need over coats
4th rain storm N.E. thankfully received - finished Road papers - Thomas Culter died of the firm of Culter & Lindsay - Arty Masshol Stone (?) died in Pekin; Saul/Sam'l F. Hawley of the form Haines & Hawly. Died.

1876
[May 13]
6th May thunder showers - growing time
7th trouble thunder shower with hail every thing afloat
8th cool & misty
10th delivered Road papers. Centennials opens today at noon - some began planting corn - Lester planted field potatoes
13th went to Peoria - sent a Draft to H.B. Waters of $97.75 on Chicago - deposited in Savings Bank $450.00 - Lester bought a corn planter - give $45.00 [May 14] saw 2 large Cinnamon Bears led around the streets - they would stand erect and dance as natural as persons - to the music of singing of their master in Indian or Spanish
17th Lester began planting corn - Walters birth day - very warm - thunder showers
18th thunder showers - set out sweet potatoes plants Augustus Burhans was here last sunday - on his way to Indianapolis [May 15]
17 Lester began planting corn
21st looks like rain
23rd frost 6º above f - ____
30th went to Peoria Decoration day - 3 companies of soldiers  went - Sp__ck(?) etc.
June 1st slight showers - yesterday Charlie Campbell got killed by a horse running away
2nd warm buried to day
2d cook NW wind - Ann & Lester gone to Peoria - went to Groveland after Uncle Henry Burhans

[May 16]
C.W. Bobb Died at Peoria
5th cool and dry dusty
5th 1st swarm Bees
6th another swam Bees - Assesor here. Sam/Tom(?) C. Smith
8th splendid thunder shower - began to suffer for want of rain.
12th another fine rain
14th Rep. Convention in Cincinnati
15th took Uncle Henry Burhans to Goodyears -thunder showers
16th very muddy - showery - got rain enough - John Drake died of Glovesville NY - 17th May
17th Lull and I went to P___ deposited $300. misty + very muddy - got too much rain
18th still showery and wet a whole week rain every day Oh Dear?
[May 18]
22nd very warm, Gibson called here on business - very warm 92º got hay in from the orchard
23rd Lightning struck the Elm tree within a few feet of our house - the report was like a heavy report of a gun in the house - Lester gone to Peoria - Mrs. Dodds visiting here
26th very heavy thunder showers - Lester's cellar afloat - Assessors roll corrected in Morton - muddy roads again

1876
[May 19]
27th June - another heavy rain Oh, Dear?
1st July misty muddy + wet as usual last night Festival at the Church
2nd rain rain
3d big rain again
4th went to Peoria(?) R.G. Ingersol oration - Poem by Baker- rain again
5th thunder and rain again rain all the time Oh. Oh? what are we to do
8th took Uncle Henry Burhans to James Goodyear's - roads drying up very warm 95º [May 20]
10th thunder showers last night - wet ag[ain] - Lester began haying
12th sent card to Junius - threatened rain
13th great rain or flood - Nothing but rain upon rain - no end till everything is ruined. Old Mr. John Dixon Died aged 92 yrs on the 6th inst
15th another rain storm as usual. St. SantaClara Died June 20 age 84
16th rain
17th rain in sight
[May 21]
18th Lester finished cutting hay - looks like pleasant weather - hope it will continue - Oat crop a failure - rust etc etc. I take it back thunder showers all around again. Mr. Anslow near Fremont(?) Died Mr. Sam Quinn Died
23rd sent card to Junius - turned cool cloudy - Mr. E.G. Smith Bible agent in Morton

[May 22]
July 26/76 getting dusty for a wonder - cool evenings - stacking Rye - Oats a failure
27th Thunder showers - Lester had a hog die of cholera - city Treasurer Binder Died in Peoria Mrs. Crittenden Died in Pekin 
29th Thunder showers Lester lost another hog
30th beautiful day
31st Lester starts for Centennial
1st August fine day
2nd went over the town for Bible cause - appearance of showers
3d Ann + Lull [May 23] went to Peoria thunder showers around 90º
5th buried 5 hogs - very warm
6th buried 5 more hogs - John Ali + Mary Ellen Saul were married
7th clear and warm - hogs still dying
9th buried 4 more pigs - warm Thunder showers Ellen Clark & Achsa Emerson here
11th Lester returned from Centennial. rain this morning - very warm sultry - Oswald house entered by burglars
13th thunder [May 24] showers very hot 94º
15th John A and wife start for Kansas fine day a little cooler
16th big rain started(?) off very pleasant
17th another big rain - enough now
23d hot 97º went to Morton settled with Oerthy(?) - got 15 dollars from Erastus
24th another hot day 
26th 54º cold started for Peoria/Peru(?) and met Tod(?) Clark. _____ gave medicine(?) to Ann - she has the ague
.

1876
[May 25]
26th cold 47º almost a frost
30th Rec'd 4.00 from Norman(?) Todd 91º hot - thunder showers
31st Mary sick
Sept 1st rain storm last night - cooler now
2nd Rep. Caucus formed a Hays/Hogs(?) & Wheeler Club
3rd rainy
5th auditors meeting - after noon a rain storm which continued all night
7th rain __ another rain
8th thunder and rain all last night - nothing but mud every thing afloat
[May 26]
Opedycke Died in Fremont
12th Central fair opens - still cloudy and gloomy
13th another rain storm
14th rain and nothing else night & day
17th clear day - Ref. Mr. Gue(?) preached sent card to Fanny
18th Beautiful day
Sept. 19th sent $11.65 to D.C. Smith Pekin 3.00 of it from sale of Books - ordered 1 doz. German Testaments with Psalms
[May 27]
20th rainy day - Mrs. Joseph Landis died - 23º warm Lull took load corn to Peoria
25th last night heavy thunder & lightning not much rain
26th Miss [blank...space for name]  was born this morning weight 6-1/2 lb. averdupois(avoirdupois?) cool N.W. wind - like fall weather
27th 40º almost a frost
28th Rep. Flag and pole raised in Morton.

DCSmith & WFHenry spoke
[May 28]
Oct 1-76 First killing frost - slight - corn all out of the way
2nd 2º above freezing - dug sweet potatoes - Jerry Cunningham died
3rd Dry/Drug(?) store broken in to - took revolvers + jewelry etc
6th first killing frost 2º below freezing
9th 2-1/2 below freezing - began digging potatoes
12th association closed in evening Dr. Harris Davis (colored) and other spoke in Morton [May 29]
14th went to Peoria - sent $1,000 to Jerald & Gibson Chinoa
15th 8º below freezing - ice 1/2 in thick - John Knox of Knoxville Died
17th visited at Charles Waters in the evening went to Groveland to a Political meeting - Mr. Thomas Crotty spoke
18th rainy day
21st finished picking cider apples & began cribbing corn
22nd another rain
[May 30]
25th went to Peoria heard Hon. James A Bli___ from Maine speak from 8 to 10 thousand present torch light procession in the evening
26th heavy frost Jos___  L. James Died in Chicago
28th very hot near 80º finished Lulls corn
29th terrific thunder from 1 oclock till morning - Christian church in Washington struck and burned - and rain not sure the like hardly for a life time
30th warm + showery
31st hear thunder + rain - again 3 nights raining

[May 31]
Nov 1st 1876 another heavy rain + thunder - 4th night rain
2d another rainy night
3d stormed again last night - cloudy and dreary - Lull went to Peoria
6th thunder + rain storm again
7th 
Election - 218 votes cast - 130 Rep 86 Dem 44 Maginty(?) - staid all night at Erastus - cloudy & very dark
10th Lester finished gathering corn - pleasant day
13th Lull finally moved to his home after noon. it began to rain from N.E.
14th 2 in of snow - and still snowing - the first snow storm - Sunday morning Mr. Samuel Aerstim/Herstim(?) Died - Gen. Giles A. Smith Died in Bloomington snow fell nearly 4 in.
17th cloudy + Ninotens(monotonous?) rain for several days - snow not yet gone
21st went to Peoria for Bank dividend $200.00 rain & snow nearly all day
22nd went to John A. to help repair cistern
23rd put away A__ celery - ground frozen
24th appearance of storm rain again OK? Dear
26th appearance of storm again
27th clear ground white with snow 1-1/2 deep 12º above zero
28th 17º above zero - I went to Groveland - on foot
29th 18º above - getting cloudy
30th Thanksgiving day - snow squalls 17º above snow 2-1/2 in  All my children except Junius present - had turkey + oysters
1st Dec. clear and severely cold 0º zero
2d 2º below zero clear - snow 2-1.2 in Lester sold his hogs at 5.35 to be delivered at Morton next Monday.

[June 1]
Dec. 7th 1876 - went to Peoria - sent for Harpers Magazine - Youth ___ + Inter Ocean - fine day
8th snow storm - a Texas Norther
9th Birth day 69 yrs old - wind gone down 16º below zero - 3 hens froze in the apple trees and fell dead
13th Mr. James K. Kellog visited us
14th turned cold again
15th 6º above splendid roads - wind south
16th 4º below 8 at Morton
[June 2]
17th Carl Emerson dangerously sick Ann & Lester gone to see him snow storm
18th 6º below zero very clear snow 2-1.2 in. Lester hauling wood pile - Simon/Linn__ Dinn(?) gave Bond for $20000.00
19th 0º pleasant day
22nd snow squalls - took up Lulls fir tree - A. tremendous large Meteor pased over - shaking the doors & window - like very heavy thunder
23rd [June 3] wrote to Fanny - Board met and accepted resignation of Wm. A. Moore & appointed Sam'l C. Smith supervisor
25th Christmas visits John A.
26th cut wood - snow every day a little
27th cut wood again - still snowing quietly - comfortable weather
27th hauled my wood pile
28th snow storm every day Lull complaining - sick - Samuel Tompkins Died in Fremont
30th - 2º below
31st snowing a little every day.

Mrs. James Anderson died
Jan. 1 1877 [June 4] 1º below zero - remarkable steady weather for the last month - clear + very cold all day - Invited to Lesters. Mr. Dodds folks also - Mr. P.P. Bliss wife & child Died of RR accident on Ashtabula RR
3d snow storm - 4 n. now
4th 4º below
6th warm pleasant day 38º Wm. Lackland(??) came here - killed beef yesterday Lull hauling his hay home. Com. Vanderbilt Died on the 4th inst.
8th 11º below zero clear snow storm yesterday - about 2-1/2 in 
10th snow storm last night - went to Washington came back on foot - Old Mrs. Dawson Died - turned warm
11th 42º at 10 oclock
12th cold NE storm - fine snow 14º above zero Darwin Davidson Died at Minouk
18th 0º zero 
15th sleet from N.E. all day
16th 2º above zero - hauled logs to mill
17th shelled corn - yesterday went to Peoria - Lester traded off Duroc to Carl Emerson - beautiful sleighing
18th warm looks like rain [June 6] 40º snow melting
19th snow storm - Lull kills his hogs
20th 4º above zero high wind a Norther - Election of Director
23rd 9º below zero - get warmer
24th 5 and so along for a week a Jan. thaw
29th still warm - Scarlet fever prevalent in Morton & vicinity - Miss/Mrs.(?) Mooberry's Child Died.
30th John OBriens Child Died - last week Mrs. Penfield Died (A sister of L. Hayward [)] went to Groveland to mill - cant yet will tomorrow 52º getting very muddy

1877
[June 7]
Feb. 1st built a chimney for John A. warm + bad roads
2nd still beautiful weather
6th tearing down our old house  + repairing it
10th still beautiful weather
11th sent a card to Junius - road getting good(?)
12th warm weather over - cold N.W. wind - let Lull have $50.00
17th clear handsome weather. Lester + wife in Peoria on a visit roads dusty  Alonson(?) Stout Died. Lester had a cow killed by Mr. Roths cattle
20th [June 8] subpoenaed as witness at Morton - gave in deposition on C.L. Whits Estate
20 examination concluded - warm dry & dusty - Charles Waters her on a visit yesterday
22nd warm & smokey Indian Summer 23º Rainy & snow flakes - Paid Taxes $7.00 - Gideon H. Rupert Died worth $100,000
26th Fanny & Augustus here. Lester hired __ began work at noon - warm spring weather
28th 12º below freezing clear & pleasant  A [June 9] protracted meeting in progress.
1st March cloudy appearance of storm Rev. Cornelison from Washington preached last one Judge Lorick exhausted(?) - sawed my wood pile. Harriet + Carl Emerson visited us - towards night it began to rain
2nd ground white with snow - winter like - last sunday Dr. Wm. S. Maus(?) Died an old settler
3d NE snow storm
4th Mar 4º below zero snow 3 or 4 in deep clear winter again.

[June 10]
Mar. 5 went to Peoria with Lull - flags up - Hayes inaugurated at Washington - great rejoicing
6th 18º above east wind
7th rain storm - sawed wood
8th rained all night - snow squalls today
9th 7º above zero N.W. wind - winter in earnest
Parker Morse Died
10th - 6º above zero - clear. had an invitation to Groveland tonight to ratify Hays & Wheeler
12th rained all night - foggy now muddy too
15th visited Lull
16th snow squalls N.E. wind - cold & bleak
[June 11]
Cousin Milo Dayton Died in the 4th ___
17th went to Peoria - sent back a draft to J.T. Gibson - improperly indorsed - very rough
20th Com. of highway meeting - snow hail and a heavy rain with thunder & lightning so dark - had to light the ____ (lamps?)
21st cloudy - everything covered with hail & ice
23rd Mark & Mary gone to Peoria to hear Emma Abbot sing
24th snowed all night - still snowing greatest snow storm of the season
25th snow fell 5 or 6 in. Winter like
[June 12]
26th 14º above zero - turned warm - went to Morton - with Augusta - she bought Wingers house + 3 lots - got Express from Chinoa
27th Auditors meeting - pleasant dry - Nina sick with scarlet  fever + diptheria - Lesters hired man sprained his foot - laid up - Charles Sill Died - awful bad roads - started to go to Mr. Smith but turned back
31st warm spring weather 73º bees flying & showers at night
April 1 - Thunder showers last night - after noon wind to the W + NW at 1 oclock 42º grow cold wind high cloudy

Apl 2d cold 1º below freezing
[June 13]
3d Town meeting - Independent ticket carried over strait Republican - 182 votes polled - I got 181 votes Town Clerk 18th term
6th rode over the town to notify overseers
7th qualified officers prepatory lecture - 13 joined the Church
8th great NE rain storm high wind
9th still rainy gloomy weather - last friday John Leadly Died. Mrs. John Mooberry Died this morning the 10th (long John)
[June 14]
12th Augusta moved to Morton made garden. Mark plowing for wheat
13th Lester began sowing oats
14th Mark sowed wheat - all the family here. Dr. Alexander Died in Pekin  - the oldest settler there
15th beautiful day - comm___ to day anniversary of Lincoln death
18th heavy rain last night - Lester & folks go to Peoria through the mud to get Mary ___
23d went to George D. Gibsons on business heavy thunder but little rain - warm 80º - 
26th Ann quite [June 15] sick - afraid of lung fever
27th rain storm - farmers have to stop plowing - cattle get grass to satisfy - built Lulls chimney day before yesterday - finished copying Road tax list
28th - heavy thunder showers. Oh? dear - gloomy
29th snow squalls. It is a fact. Oh? how muddy 3 days storm - good for grain and grass - Ann some better
30th ice & snow all around - winter like - Mr.       Oyer Died in Morton of Consumption- last Saturday

May 1 1877 heavy frost 2º freezing
1st freezing - built chimney for smokehouse
2nd went to Mary's came home in a rain storm
3d rained all night - Gloomy prospect for farmers
5th looks like rain - Delivered Road papers to overseers - had to appoint one to fill vacancy. Mrs. Nelson Crosby Died in Kansas. Mr. + Mrs. Scrivins parted - Bully???
6th another rain storm Oh? dear - bad?
7th rained all night - still rainy - every thing afloat - water in Lesters cellar - gloomy prospects for crops
[June 17]
on Sunday Apr. 31st [?] William Gawnoway Brownlow Parson Brownlow Died at Knoxville
11th Lull came after Ann- Raining a little - planted my potatoes - Judde Weed Died a few days since
12th went to Peoria left some Drafts with Savings Bank - Ellen has Billious fever - Phillips the Nursery man died
13th misty - some rain
14th 80º thunder showers yesterday fine growing time now

thunder showers - Lull had a Son Born on the 14th at 1 oclock AM

[June 18]
16th Mr. G.F.Gibson called here thunder showers every day
17th 86º good corn weather Lull planting corn 
18th 92º every thing in bloom
19th school Election - voted for addition to school house
20th sent cards to Fanny and Junius thunder showers
21st 6º below temperate(?) cool
23d 45º cold NE wind
24th frost 8º above freezing - Legislature adjourned set out Sweet Potatoes last evening

May 26 / 77
[June 19] 
7º above freezing a slight frost again - went to Peoria got Dividend of $150.00
28th Lester shelled corn
29th very dry want of rain
30th Decoration of soldiers graves in Peoria - went to see it - very dusty
31st visited in Groveland - very high wind - great want of rain
1st June - splendid rain last night - growing time now - dug cellar drain
2nd Lull & wife both sick. Dr. called in wife + g sent for - Lull has Billious fever
46th Lull very sick - wife better - showery hail in places [June 20]
6th Lull still sick - showery yet
7th thunder showers last night - hot sun. come home left Ann I had to go back again looks like rain again - bad for corn plowing
8th showers too wet for plowing corn Lull better so came home
9th rain all night + today - cold rain. Gloomy
11th another rain storm. Oh? Dear. O.OS. Lester & I went to Peoria got prikits(packets?) - showers all around - mud - mud etc.
15th thunder showers again Assessor here - hot weather
16th heavy thunder showers all night and today - gloomy prospects - floods all over the west - Oh? Dear?
17th beautiful day went to Church Mr. Hoffman's oldest child died
18th Thunder showers. again as usual.
19th terrific thunder showers all night and to day rainy - nothing but rain water - first swarm of bees yesterday - lit(?) in the willow tree lost them
20th rain again

21st thunder shower all night - Oh Dear
23d thunder shower off North
24th rain this morning - Comm___ to day Dr. Crinbear(?) joins our Church - wrote to Fannie
25th Corrected Ass. Roll. severe thunder shower + severe wind - blew down fences - Junius + Georgie came here
26th another very fearful thunder storm - wind & hail - no end to it - every thing afloat - farmers have the blues
30th thunder storm last night - very hot - finished piling wood - Lester went to Peoria
[June 23]
1st July - cool 42º looks now like fair weather - rain a little
2nd heavy thunder showers all afloat again. Excursion to Henry a failed(?)
4th July firing of canon & thunder & lightning as usual - celebration a failure in our grove
5th another dreadful thunder storm with severe wind from the N.E. it broke off a large limb from the willow tree
8th another thunder storm
12th went to Peoria deposited $700 - at 4 per cts.
15th Sent letter to the U.S. assistant Treasurer Chicago - Lester finished plowing corn + began haying - Mark cutting his wheat
16th thunder shower afternoon cleared off beautiful - Lester cutting hay
17th Junius started home. beautiful morning
19th 4º below temperate. Wind N.W. getting dusty Lester finished haying
21st cool 54º finished shaking rye & wheat - dry beautiful weather
22nd 54º again
26th universal strike on RR

nearly burnt up pittsburg - great excitement all over the Country
27th thunder shower last night much needed
28th fine shower - roads slippery - Stout thrashed his wheat Lull has 37 bu.
30th called Dr. or Ann - beautiful morning - Lester & Marc cutting oats
1st August fine rain last night fine prospects now for corn + potatoes
2nd Ann not as well - clear beautiful weather
5th 52º cool, clear beautiful day
6th Election [June 26] for Judge - slight rain
7th foggy - warmer
10th finished stacking oats
11th Jury trial on road damage heavy thunder storm
12th thunder showers again - could not go to Church
13th took George to Fremont - terrible thunder storm with hail last night - Lightning struck the Store in Fremont - roads very muddy
14th cool 57º Lester thrashed his grass(?) - thunder showers every day - no end to it
18th Election at [June 27] Morton to determine Incorporating the town - thunder showers around every day this week - Lester working on the roads
20th helped Lull stack oats 
21st severe thunder storm high wind - Dr. Moses Troyer Died in Peoria
24th Charlie Mathews visited here
26th went to Groveland to Church etc 
27th very hot 90º sent letter to Nina Dayton & to Junius
28th hot + dry - looks showery

[June 28]
Thomas STrickland Died in a drunk runaway etc etc
29th heavy thunder storm last evening - rainy today
31st Lester's hired man left off work - wishes to go back to Switzerland 94º very hot thunder showers all around.
1st Sept. cooler 60º hazy and cloudy etc
2nd 50º cool & clear - Ann sick severe cold
3d went to Peoria on business
4th Auditors meeting 47º morning - Brigham Young is Dead 29th __ at list(?)
5th my wedding day cloudy - a little rainy - Deacon Sperry Died near Fremont
9th rainy day
10th still rainy & wet
14th - hot(?) and dry - Electioin in Morton for 6 trustees of the village
15th heavy shower last night
16th went to Fremont church - thunder shower
17th went to Deer Creek etc roads muddy
18th frost 36º
19th visited J.K.Kellogg
21st Lull thrashed wheat 42-1/2 bu oats 26c Cousin McCracken Died - fine weather [June 30] 
23d John Uiberrhrin(?) Died
26th Adam Holiker Died - a carpet weaver - a near neighbor - thunder showers - heavy- wet etc. James Roberts wife Died 6 weeks ago
27th sent Box Honey to J.W. Clark 26 lb gross
Oct. 1 - very warm - sultry
5th frost 4º above freezing - Ann & I went to Peoria - Mark thrashed
6th come home - Dr. Wagonseller Died - run over by R.R. train

1877
8th Oct - rainy day - cool
[July 1]
9th Equinoctial storm
10th cooler - very muddy
11th gathered in our winter apples
12th another thunder showery day Oh! what roads
13th 14th showery
15th warm showery - No frost to hurt yet
16th very warm 81º no frost to kill yet
17th Rainy day - Lull sick we are sent for
18th still rainy -gloomy
19th rain all night - heavy NE rain storm fearful rain come down through the roof a tempest in earnest
20th rainy all day again 4th day - Town Meeting for Constable - 50 votes polled Frederic Marchal elected
21st rained all last night - cleared off for a wonder - David Melvilles child Died
22nd 2º above frost(?) clear
24th finished digging potatoes
25th rainy all day & night
26th still rainy Oh? Dear??
29th Lester's hired man commenced work cribbing corn - cooler - wind NNW
1st Nov. sleet disagreeable day - gathered in cabbage & beets
2nd still rainy and [July 3]  cold - disagreeable weather Lester went to Peoria with apples and honey to Diver(deliver?) - Doc. L.F. Smith died - 3º - 4º below freezing first time freeze - Senator Oliver P. Morton Died on 1st inst. Samuel Voris Died 2nd
5th first snow ground white
6th Election of County Judge - Treasurer

[July 4]
14th Oh! Dear another S.E. rain storm is there no end to rain & mud. A mover went by with beds - exposed to rain 2 women & child 2 men - horse nearly given out - reched horrible
15th went to Marc's he gone to Peoria - but Oh such roads
16th very foggy - cant husk corn - so frosty
20th helped Lester finish gathering corn looks like rain every day & rain it is. Ann gone to Morton 4 oclock not home yet sold Erastus box honey 20 lb gross
21st rained all night - still raining
24th foggy - fear rain again - roads awful
25th misty - didn't go to church W.F. Coolbaugh Died by suicide - Prest. of Union National Bank Chicago
26th rain all night & today Oh O? O still storming
27th snow squally all day
28th ground white & frozen 9º below freezing now 11º below - snow squalls all day again
29th Thanksgiving - children at home. J.T. Gibson called here snow squalls all day 
30th snow squalls [July 6] again - all the time.
1st Dec. snow squalls all day
2nd cleared off for a wonder wind south sent card to Junius
4th another rain storm 16 yrs a Ellen died. Carl Emerson horse got away last night & ran off in the woods with a saddle on
7th went to Peoria got Back hundred of $150.00
9th Birth day 70 yrs old. clear E wind 14º below freezing last night - an eclips of Venus by the Moon - a curious spectacle shall never see again.

11th warm pleasant weather these days bees flying - roods smoothing down - sent letter to Jewell & Gibson - Mrs. Charles Hinmon Died - in Iowa
12th visited at Groveland
13th sent for Youth Companion - awful roads - but pleasant weather - cutting wood
16th cloudy - started with buggy to Church roads so awful Ann went back and I went on foot
17th rained all night 42º this morning - had a summons from U.S. Court at Springfield - by Payson in behalf of Republic Insurance Co. for [July 8] $400.00
18th killed hogs  2 in No. rainy day creel up higher than seen last spring
19th still rainy - took some fresh pork to Mary roads never so bad before
20th clear warm spring day - frogs singing house flied about. Moses H. Grinnell Died in N.Y. 64º 
21st warm as ever - Went to Morton drew up a petition for a new road from Morton north to the town line - J.H. Crandall called here for me to approve Collectors Bond of 21000
22nd rain storm again
24th great rain Peter Weyrick Died Oh? dear is there to be no end
25th Christmas - still rainy 54º Oh? O? O
26th still rainy NE 41º a fat hog sick every body have the blues
27th still misty N.E. wind but warm 4th day rain
28th misty
29th NE rain storm colder
30th still cloudy
31st 3º below freezing for a wonder - still cloud over a week without the sun - very gloomy.

[July 10]
Jan 1 1878 - clear this morning 3º below freezing out to be 20º at least farmers cannot market their hogs - roads so very bad - no moving any thing - wind getting southerly - getting hazy - fear another storm
4th Lester sold his hogs for $3.70 cold snow squalls roads terrible rough - break through - last night 6º above zero 
5th wind south 8º above
6th 4º above too cold to go to Church
7th 4º below - great - hope the roads will get better now
10th rode on horseback to Peoria on business  Ann & I rode to Peoria in buggy - sent Draft to Chenoa to Roscoe G. Judan of $768.__
12th wind S.E. - King Victor Emanuel Died
13th snow storm - Temperance meeting at the church - great enthusiasm - many joining
14th cloudy 2º below freezing - only an inch of snow - Daniel Cheever Died at Delway at 76 yrs - drew up a wood pile - on the sled
15th cloudy a little colder 6º below freezing
18th visited Charles Waters - road begin to break through again - mud [July 12] as usual warm
19th commissioners met at Lowmans bridge
26th stormy half the time
21st Wind N.W. a little snow last night 32º - muddy as usual
22nd went to Morton & to Lulls
23d 13º above zero hope it will keep cold now - roads awful rough
24th wind S.E. warm as ever - Spring weather David M. Cummings  Died. partner of G. Emerson(?)
26th at noon 4º above freezing - Preparatory lecture
27th N.E. rain storm - awful roads again
31st snow storm - looks like winter - 6º below freezing

Feb 1st snowy a little - got up  a wood pile
2nd misty - wind NE for a number of days
3d wrote to Junius clear 13º below freezing Mark & Mary gone to Peoria to spend sabbath
6th rode up to Bernards & to Andrew Risers - warm spring day
7th another spring day
8th N.E. rain storm - cool
9th snow 2 in deep - soft bottom - still misty snow from N.E.
10th snow in drifts - wind N.W. still snowy - 19º
11th - 10º above zero - clear & pleasant - Uncle Henry C. Burhans Died yesterday in Burlington Iowa 12º at noon 6º above freezing - warm + sun shine
[14]th St. Valentine - wet muddy & snowing - very disagreeable - Ex. Secretary of the Navy under Lincoln Gideon Welles Died in Hartford Con - Pope Nino Died on the 7th inst.
16th showery & foggy - frost about all out - Milton Shirtleff wife Died
20th went to Marks & Lull's came home in the rain - awful bad roads
21st rainy day - paid Taxes - $5.82. Lull's $46.19. Law seat(?) at Morton
22nd still rainy Oh! Dear - will there ever be and end to this dismal weather - D.C. Caligan(?) failed in Ruins
24th stormy all the time for a week 25º summoned as witness - by John T. White - roads impassible nearly
28th - went to Marks & Lull's. Erastus wife very sick.
1st March - had my wood sawed -looks like rain - Old Mr. Luke Humphrey Died a few day ago & M. M. Eaton wife Died
2nd rain storm
3rd still raining - Oh! Dear? mud mud etc etc etc
4th went to Peoria & back by 11 oclock then went to Breckins(?) - awful muddy roads

1878
6th Mar. thunder - showers - spring weather grass looks green - Lester sawing wood for Mark. Hon. Benjamin F. Wade died last saturday
8th showery - buds out spring like
9th moved the Library(?) to Mr. Guisaer(?) who is appointed Librarian
10th raining again
15th pleasant day. Erastus wife dangerously sick - had counsels(?) of Dr.'s. Lester & wife went to Peoria - Rec'd package of seeds from Agriculture Bureau Washington D.C. - sowed onions seed yesterday - James P. Harkness Died 
16th thunder last night - [17] cool N.W. wind
20th Warren's Wife with Mr. Gillums(?) folke visted here
21st Lester took off his rye to Morton
22nd - plowed garden - planted early potatoes - sowed peas - got from Washington D.C.
23rd sowed cabbage, beets, & tomatoes seed from Washington D.C. in E. garden. warm weather bugs and out
24th colder - 1/2º below freezing - great change since yesterday
25th 9º below freezing
26th board of Auditors meeting - showery
27th thunder showers - warmer
30th NE rain storm
31st Erastus wife better
1st April 2º below freezing - clear & pleasant - splitting wood
2nd town meeting - supervisor Samuel Smith town clerk Jn M. Roberts assessor Christ. May - collect. Samuel R. Plum Com. of highway Alex Mooberry 185 votes polled - 6th school election director
7th wrote a letter to Junius - rainy not go to meeting
9th Lester to Peoria - rainy all day
10th rained all night & today S.E. rain storm - Amelia Kingman Died last week - Old Mrs. Roth Died at Dan'l Roths the 11th.

1878
13th rainly
14th thunder showers muddy - can't go to church for rain
15th Ann's birth day 60 years old - rain last night
16th thunder showers - so could not go to Peoria - Election for town village trustees and police Magistrate - 
17th went to Peoria
