18th thunder showers last night - too muddy to plow - Boss Tweed Died - last Friday
19th thunder showers last night again & to day
21st thunder showers 
22nd heavy thunder showers - too much.  Enough. plenty
23rd terrible thunder storm last night water in Lester's cellar - every thing afloat
24th heavy rain all night - rain every day. farmers get the Blues
25th rain. Nani__(?) visiting here. All the Children here
26th took Navir/Nassir(?) to Fremont - still showres
27th rain again - every day regular
28th still showery
1st May - another thunder storm - O Dear are we to have last year repeated - ground too wet - now for plowing - Discouraging time - Stewart's elevator was set on fire & burnt - mostly insured
2nd heavy thunder showers again
3d Lester began planting corn - turned cooler
7th thunder showers very warm Lester + Cornbise(?) went to Fremont on Church business
8th thunder showers again - Lester goes to help John A. plant corn
12th went to Peoria an Excursion from Decatur ___
13th frost 2º above
14th frost & ice - sad for fruit & garden
16th rain storm - Miss Wallace to be married this evening to Sam'l Quin__(?)

17th visited [July 22] Marys- Marks papering rooms - Stewarts' Store opened
18th terrible thunder storm all day - of flead(?) afrain corn will rot in the ground
19th misty Oh? such roads terrible thunder showers with hail
20th Lester goes to Pekin as juror - clear & cool
23rd thunder shower again - no end to rain
25th went to Peoria with Marc. No Dividend from Sri__(Second?) National Bank hard upo 
26th cooler looks like good weather. Mr. G.L. Roberts preached his last sermons here  showers [July ]
27th went to Mr. G. Mums after sweet potatoe plants got 300 for $1.00 - roads drying up - Lester goes to Pekin on the jury again
29th terrible Thunder showers with hail 
30th Decoration day - turned of fair weather  - sent letters to Mim Dayton + Mattie Roberts Iowa
31st another heavy thunder showers - as usual
1st June looks like rain again - discouraging for farmers afternoon heavy thunder showers
2nd heavy rain with terrible thunder - streams higher than ever - what will become of us - gloomy prospects
3d last night fearful thunder & lightning wind changed to N.W. cleared off at last
6th went to Peoria - bought a suit of clothes - wife went home alone - staid at J.W. Clarks
7th 8th on the JB+W R.R to Indianapolis arrived at 5:40 oclock - began to rain 
sunday 9th rainy - went to Congregational Church heard Rev.      McCullock preach the catholic procession spoilt by the rain - yesterday visited the court house. today visited

the Elevator which can contain 25000 bushels of grain - then went to the stock yards - linghh(?) 340 paus(?) breadth 165 paers(?) - showers again - rain every day - Maggie Johnson died - a freind of Nanin
10th went to Congretational Church. Mr. McCullock preached - went home in the rain.
11th visited the high school + kindergarten - then to the chamber of commerce - saw and heard the Telephone. - 1-1/2 miles distant quite distinctly. walked up to the Exposition Buildings - a darkey(?) pie in there - getting warm - a fire was comfortable - a few days past
12th rode to Cincinnati - visted the Zoological gardens - rode up and down the inclined planes then went to the river - took a skiff & crossed the Ohio river into Kentucky - + under the suspension Bridge - saw the old market house tat I saw 48 years ago  - put u at the Walnut street house. William G. Bryant Died this morning
13th walked over [July 27] suspension Bridge to Kentucky - also walked around the old Market house - afternoon visited the Music Hall. saw & heard the great Organ.
Friday at 5 oclock started for Indianapolis - arrived at 10-1/2 oclock P.M.
14th pleasant morning warm. saw & heard the Phonograph then visited the old State House grounds then visited the State Board of Agriculture + Museum - expect to start home tomorrow.

[4] 
15th started for home - [July 28] arrived at Peoria at 3-20 oclock P.M. rode home with Jno McGinnis
16th sunday went to Church - voted to accept Mr. Roberts resignation
18th Regatta at Peoria continues 4 days
23d cold 56º appears like dry weather at last
24th reviewing assessment Roll - hot sun Lester shelled his corn - and sold for 32 cts
25th fine thunder shower last night - good corn weather now - Wilson Kip Died - a few days since
28th went to see Lockwood - very warm
[July 29]
29th met Lockwood at Morton - got a Mortgage of 300 dollars - on his land
30th heavy thunder shower - glad to see
1st July - heavy thunder showers - enough
2d 5 swarms of Bees - 3 went into one hive
3d misty - wind N.E. hoed beans + potatoes. Benj. E. Miles Died 15 ult. 59 yrs
4th July Druids Picnic - in Mays Grove - Temperance celebration at Buck eye - went to both. Sydnie Breese Died, one of the Supreme Judges born 1800 Henry Field Died [July 30] last monday
7th very hot - hoed sweet potatoes last time
9th sent letter to Gibson. Lester began haying
11th 96º gettng in haw (hay?) 
12th very hot dry weather 2 oclock 100º almost melts one.  Mr. Lathrop Died in Peoria
14th wrote to Fanny - hot weather now 100º
15th hot 100º at 5 PM Blood head the hottest day I ever experienced seems as if every thing would burn up
16th TJ Gibson here last night - 101º hot weather every day - getting in hay.

17th 100º again - every day - Oh? Dear? are we to burn [July 31] up 
18th 96º appearance of rain - all blown over - dry time
19th 96º thunder + appearance of rain. Lester & Marc went to Peoria(?) - got the money in a draft of Gibson
22nd cool 58º at sun rise - needing rain - dusty. Began harvesting oats - very heavy - want of harvesters
24th 91º 25th 97-1/2º  Lester helping Marc bind oats splendid rain - gladly received
29th Charles Roberts Died, a son of E.H. Roberts - partial Eclipse of the sun - help Lull stack oats
30th thunder showers last night
31st went to Fremont for Georgia - visited C. Waters - 94º
1st Aug. - last night terrible thunder + lightning heavy rain - cleared off warm. Hail as large as hickory nuts  fell - some very jagged
7th another thunder storm - plenty of rain now
5th 91º Lester thrashing for Marc. Messinger
6th hot again 92º
7th stacking oats - clear and warm
9th went to Pekin thunder showers - visited in Groveland. Mrs. Jacob Slough Died
10th Rain last night 
12th stacking oats
13th heavy thunder shower last night
17th rained all the forenoon same thunder
18th warm 92º - Ann sick - with a fever
19th hot weather 94º
20th heavy fearful thunder storm all night
21st began fall plowing - Thomas Roberts & family visited here. Dan'l Wood Died- killed coupling cars
23d Ann & Mary gone to Mr. Landis
24th 98º extremely hot again - went to church business meeting and to John A. in the afternoon clouds began to appear at sun down - an awful thunder storm burst upon us - vivid lightning - and rain
25th sunday cooler wind N.E. cleared off. W.C. Bartlitt Died

1878
29th Aug - took [August 1] George to Fremont on his way to Indianapolis - pleasant weather gave George $3.00 - Hon. W.H. Cheney Died by suicide one of the oldest settlers of McLean county owned 1200 acres of land
1st Sept. went to sabbath school 90º hot again road dusty
3d Auditors meeting
5th Old settlers reunion - at Peoria - Ann & I went - roads dusty
8th Mary sick Dr. Called warm 90º
9th great rain storm last night & today
10th fair at Peoria - Cool 50º roads muddy
11th 41º cool - Lull got his wild bees from the woods. Old Mrs. [August 2] Apdyck Died in Fremont J.C. Finnegan Died Ex. Co. Clerk
16th warm again 84º Lockwood called. Mary still sick. Lester is to thrash tomorrow
17th thrashing here 370 bu oats 79 Rye 22 wheat
18th 88º warm
19th 88º again - went to the mill with a great very high wind from the south
20th rain storm turned cool
21st first frost 4º above freezing Mary still sick
22nd David Todd preached - voted to hire him for 6 months - rec'd letter from Hawleysville
23d cool & clear
25th thunder storm & hail in places last night & today [August 3] heavy thunder storm
27th went to Washington settled with Lockwood exchanged his notes for Naffsingers(?)
28th showery
30th went to Peoria with Dodds
14th Oct. high wind from the south for 3 days - Mary no better - went to Lull's his hired girl sick. Afternoon heavy wind & thunder storm. rc'd letter rom Junius old Mrs. John Plum Died a few days ago.
2nd Ann & I went to Pekin - visited Austin's
3d rain last night  -
4th rain again
5th rain every night. Mary some better
6th Frost 3º above freezing

1878
8th Oct Lull [August 4] and I went to Peoria with apples. got 30 cts - Thunder showers - got wet
9th a terrific thunder storm last night - with hail + rain + wind
10th another thunder storm last night
11th thunder storm
12th Lester finished digging potatoes
13th another thunder storm as usual
15th Ann and I went to John A's - Board Register today showery & warm 82º
16th high wind - looks stormy - wind south - heavy thunder storm - high wind [August ]
17th cool wind North 39º finished digging my potatoes
18th cold 1º above freezing 
19th first killing frost - 4º below freezing
20th 2º below 
22nd Lester went to Peoria for a Dr. Mary worse - went after Mary Messinger made Chaw(?) Chas(?)
23d 4º below frezing
26th first stow storm E.J. Cornwell & WP Rock had law suit
27th 3º below freezing fences + roofs white with snow
28th 10º below freezing
30th turned cold went to Peoriy  got Draft issued from Gibson
31st Mrs. Emerson visited here
Nov. Lull has another son born Named ______________ turned warm again
2nd helped Lull plaster his house
3d 10º below freezing clear
5th Election - polled 202 votes - Republican majority of 23 over Democrat and Green back - get home a little before 2 oclock in the morning
6th rain storm
7th went to Pekin to carry Elections returns visited Dr. Harris
8th clear + pleasant
9th wrote letters to Wm. G. Ledie(?) Can.(or Com.?) Agriculture

to Mim Dayton to Betsy Ann Hodge & to AB Roberts [August] to JB Roberts
10th rainy
11th showery from the N.W. rained all night
12th went Morton - got town Hall insured for $700 in the Home N. York company for 5 years for $21.00 (&.50 cts)
12th clear beautiful day - Lester finished picking corn. Mary better went to Lulls
15th went to Morton
16th rainy all night. foggy & misty all day
17th cloudy & muddy - Bible society meeting - Mr. Hartshorn Agent
18th still cloudy & warm
20th Ed's Slander suit begins today - I was summoned last night went to Morton found Defendants witnesses not wanted until tomorrow - no come home
24th went to church [August 8] Ezekiel Seeley Died - of cancer - 
25th clear beautiful weather - No Dividend from Second National Bank again
26th went to Pekin on the train
27 Cordelia Roberts V.S. W.H. Cornbiss(?) - suit for slander - was witness - in the evening was discharged
28th thanksgiving - had children home fine pleasant day
29th 10º below frozen - the coldest for a long time - clear Indian Summer
Dec. 1st 1878 Winter. ground white - N.E. snow storm - after a long [August 9] pleasant indian summer - Edwin's great slander case - decided no cause of action - Bill Scott here yesterday
3d visited Mr. Gillum
4th 6º below frozen Ellen died 18 yrs ago. A.T. Stewart failed in Morton
5th H.W. Gove visited here
6th snow squalls
7th Mary come home from Peoria
8th snow storm winter like snowed nearly all day 4 in. fell
9th 3º below freezing Birth Day - 71 yrs old - Justin Olds Died in Peoria Mrs. George E. Beckwith & infant daughter Died in Burlington. daughter of A. H. Burhans 1201 Division St. Iowa

16º
11th 16º cloudy. Mary a little better
13th great snow storm - N.E. snowed all day & night it fell over 14 inches
14th snow squalls from N.W.
16th 8º above zero - fine sleighing Went to Groveland to mill - splendid sleighing
17th killed a fat hog wind south went after the grist - rec'd 10.20 cts for service as clerk of election
18th Saml. R. Plan(?) with his Bond for me to sign a approval
19th 11º below zero. sharp air. Pork down 23ct
20th another snow storm
21st snow fell 4 in. Anthony Field Died
22nd snow again high wind 3º below very cold
23d 2º below - snowing a little every day
24th 17º below zero severe cold weather [August 11] clear
25th Christmas - 6º below zero clear & pleasant Lesters folks all gone to Dodds. Bayard Taylor Died on the 21st Inst. James Thurbons(?) Died
26th 2º below snowing. Mark getting out ice
27th 5º above - snow fell 1 in
28th 13º below zero
January 1 1879 20º a fine snow falling - Lull took 2 swarms of bees home yesterday
2nd a Norther. high wind 20º below zero - awful severe - clear at 12 oclock it is 14º below clear keen wind fed the fire
3d 23º clear wind N.W. at noon 10º below 0º
4th 20º below zero [August 12] at noon 6º below
5th 18º below zero wind continues NW & clear - at noon 4º below
6th 13º below zero - clear
8th snow fell 1 in last night - turning cold again - began packing ice yesterday - Lester sick - George L. Biston(?) Died on the 6th Ice(Inst.?) of Old Settlers. Peter Wyneck(?) Died - County treasurer formerly
9th 11º below zero - clear & pleasant
10th 13º below zero - Lester packing ice
11th finished packing ice - Abigail and children visited here
12th 2º below zero - very foggy wind S.E.  - Caleb Cushing Died - a week ago
15th new Draft yesterday from Juell & Gibson $500 snow storm from N.E. 4 in and a crust on top
16th storm over wind N.W. 22º pleasant

18th Went to Peoria with Marc & Mary deposited $500 in [August 13] 2nd National Bank
19th 11º below zero very cold - went to Church
21st 5º above - at noon above frozen - beautiful day
23rd appearance of a thaw
25th 46º Jan. thaw
27th foggy - a rainy snow going off
1st Feb. a snow squall in the morning - cleared off - pleasant wind NW - Lester sawed wood for John A.
2nd 11º above zero
5th Mr. Gillum & family started for Kansas - large number of neighbors gathered at the Depot to bid them farewell - pleasant weather Mr. Lockwood moves to Kansas with [August 14] them - Mr. M.L. Sullivant Died owning(?) 48000 acres
7th 11º below frozen Lester hauling off his oats at 20-1/2 cts
10th Chester Cole began work for Lester for 10 mo. at $15 per mo. - looks like a storm - killed a hog. Mary no better
11th rainy all night - yesterday hauled up a wood pile - Mr. G.D. Gibson here yesterday
12th snow storm - 2-1/2 in tuned cold - Lester sawed his wood
13th 4º above zero - sun dogs
14th 6º below zero - Lester took load of rye to Peoria(?)
15th went to Peoria - drew $300 from Bank
16th snow storm 4 in. [August 15]
17th still snowy - Lester & Wife start for Colorado Springs
18th 2º below zero - clear Dr. R.B.M. Wilson Died suddenly in Washington I.E. Leonard Died very suddenly in Pekin
19th Law Suit in Morton - Spaulding charged with theft town Hall ____ - Wind changed to NW a real Texas norther - snow squalls
20th 4º above zero - Baldawars(Baldomero) Espartero Died Marshall of Spain Thomas Lord Died a millionaire at N York - Joseph Birket Died as Son of Tom Burkit.

25th Rec'd card from Lester in Colorado - at evening turned cold 
26th 3º below zero - high wind A Norther - Samuel Daws Died aged    yrs
27th walked to Peoria. cold 8º below zero - sent a Draft to W.M. Scott of $300.00
28th cloudy with S.E. wind.
1st March Sml Daws buried in Roberts cemetery - cold chilly wind - John Cornwell visited here - Loaned $1000 to E.L. McClintock
2nd great snow storm - from the N.E. - Kissinger Died in Morton
6th received letter from Lester Marked 4th round in the 6th quick time - thing fast
7th Chester(?) [August 17] breaking potatoe patch
8th 74º hot weather. Mr. Dodds visits us - Mina come home 
9th showery
10th wrote letters to C.J. Gibson & Haynes Jordan & Co. - warm & showery
13th rec'd a letter from Lester mailed on the 11th. Mr. Erastus Childs staid with us getting subscribers to the Tazewell Co. History
14th subscribed for the History - A Norther again 9º above zero ground white with snow - winter like - heavy(?) wind all night
15th snow all day  2-1/2 in deep
16th 4º above zero - clear. Mr. Childs staid over sunday  Hon. Elihu Burritt Died on the 6th Mar.
18th went to Lulls who is sick 6º above. helped the Com. make out their report - Congress must at Extra Business(?)
19th came home Lull better - clear - south wind
20th put up Notice for town meeting - snow storm 2-1.2 in 
21st warmer - snow going off - sent letter to Lester

22nd another snow storm 7(?) in. Willis Todd has law suit in Morton to day
25th Auditors meeting - received pay 4.65 cts - got School Bonds cashed
26th sowed wheat - slight showers - and sowed oats
27th went to Peoria trading sold packed butter for 10 cts
28th thunder showers
29th caucus. Rep + Dem
30th showery - cooler 2º above freezing
Apr 1st annual town meeting whole No. of votes 211 - no. for Town Clerk 210     Wm. Smith elected Supervisor
Apr. 2nd went to Morton and qualified - come home facing a Norther very cold 
3d - 18º above zero - a North  frosty windows - ground solid
5th went to Morton - school election for Director Clint Stoker elected
6th went to church - at nigh(t) thunder storm
7th rained nearly all night - Mr. Erastus Childs staid over sunday
8th 4º below freezing - Chester(Lester?) sowed oats
9th thunder showers - all day & night
10th still raining - very wet now - farmers had to stop work
12th com. of highway organized by choosing Dan Uwziku(?) treasurer. Atr(?) Mooberry general overseer & J.L.Haywood clerk. Treasurer gave bond for $4,000. Lester is at Salina Kansas
13th Stephen Field died
15th visited at Groveland - I went to Pekin - got Deed of my farm recorded - sold to Lester B. Roberts 32º at freezing
17th 2 months ago Lester & wife starts for Colorado Springs  1º above freezing
18th 3º below freezing - cold backward spring - sowed peas onion and beets from Agriculture Department
22d paid Lull $10.00 for LBR on his note - getting dry - at 2 p.m. 86º old Red has a calf - sowed Tomatoes + cabbage - Agriculture 
23d 87º want rain
24th John Bradshaw committed Suicide by hanging himsel in the Barn Died

29th Apr. began making soap
[August 22]
30th cold N.E. wind 4º above freezing - a backward spring - very dry
1st May 2º below freezing - mailed a letter to Legal adviser of town officers
2d a dispach received by Mr. Dodds from Lester. Mary is worn & is coming home
4th fine rain last night. Red has a calf. Lester came home at last. Oh! how rejoiced we are. Mary at Mr. Dodds.
5th cool planted late potatoes - rode to Mr. Dodds to see Mary [August 23] who is very low. Gen. John A. Dix Died a few days since
6th 2º above freezing - frost etc  Judge Barnard Died. Bishop Ames Died
7th 4º above freezing - at a little after 4 oclock Lester's wife Mary Died at her Fathers Dodds of Consumption - only returned from Colorado Springs 4 days - will be buried day after to morrow at 2 P.M.
8th very cold yet 4º above freezing
12th at 1 oclock 91º very hot sun - began planting corn [August 24]
14th splendid rain wanted very much. Let Dr. Conibear(?) have $400.00 for 9 mo. Mr.s John Cunningham Died yesterday. Wm Rounsville Died formerly of Peoria. Mrs. Lightener Died - by accident in a Elevator
20th thunder shower last night
28th went to Peoria got Bank dividend of $120.00 - bought a carpet for $21.75
24th rode to Kensrgres(?) + exchanged notes - very dusty - great want of rain.

1879
25th May Lightning struck into the ground [September 4] a little N.E. of the barn + made the dust fly not far from me
26th misty - day no rain - last sunday evening Wm. Lloyd Garrison Died - aged 75 yrs
29th went to Peoria brot home carpet + tin for roof - very dusty
30th Lull + Wife went to Peoria. Decoration Day
31st wrote a road petitions for Hirstins(?)
1st June slight rain from N.E. cool
2nd Election for 1 supreme Judge & 3 current Judges.  Freeman Kingman Died at Tremont. Hon. E.C. Ingersol Died at Washington
4th slight shower - better than nothing
8th have a lame back - cannot go to church.  Mrs. Ellds(?) Pruitt Died of cancer.  Gen. James Shields Died 1st June
8th 96º at 2 PM - great want of rain
10th fine rain last night - my back still lame
11th splendid rain again - great rejoicing sent a receipt to John T. Gibson - Chin___ on his note $624.50 June 6, 1879\
8th fine shower yesterday - Lester horded tile - paid $19.00
[September 6]
James Orton Woodruff Died of Indianapolis
15th fine showers
16th went to Groveland to mill wheat & corn - cool 10º above freezing
20th saved the 1st bees lit in the willow tree
21st a welcome rain storm all the fore noon
23rd correcting amount roll -- some have began haying + harvesting wheat
25th splendid Rain storm - all the A.M. Mr. Naffzinger come here Lester worked on the road.

Higest R.Roads
[September 7]
Railroad over the Andes      15,646 ft
Union Pacific                         8,573
Central Pacific                      7,021
North Pacific                         5,420
Mount Cenis(?) tunnel           4,390
St. Gothard(?) tunnel         3,786
the Brunner(?)                        4,475
Tunnels
Mount St. Gothard         9-1/4 miles long

 "       Cenis                  8   "   "   less a few yards

Hoosac                          4-3/4 "    "
[September 8]
Rev. Dr. Hall says there 4 perils threatning the Community
A defective public spirit.
A weak commercial conscience
An exaggerated idea of personal freedom
And the feebleness of religious life among us
Croup or Diptheria Cure
Tar & Turpentine vapor inhaled
[September 9]

[September 10]
Largest yield of wheat    Minor
Jas. L. Ray in Clark Co. - 1 acr - 102 bushels
11th 11º above zero - frost flying - roads terrible rough - Ann very sick all night - sent for medicine
Highest inhabited house in the World
is in Park Co. Colorado - 14,157 feet
Junius lives at No., 211 Park Avenue
[September 11]
Closing cracks in Stoves
finely pulverized clay and a little slalate(?) mixed with great quantity of fine wood ashes sifted through a fine sieve  - made into a paste & applied on cold stove - will harden & effectively stop cracks.
Seneca Indian Count 10
1 Scot - 2 Technee  3 Shengh 4 Kahh  5 Wish  
6 zea  7 Cha-dack  8 Tegyunk  9 Tek Tahn  10 Was-sank
[September 12[
words written on a Porlat  
7371 words
5 births at once by Mrs. Adam Murray New Glasgow Nova Scotia 3 girls 2 boys - all well formed + doing well.

1879
26th June [September 13] another fine rain last night - enough now
28th fine rain - growing time
July 1st hot day
2nd 97º 
3d visited Mr. Dodds - 96º Lester harvesting wheat thunder showers
July 4th staid at home
7th Lester began haying 100º very hot thunder shower around
8th thunder showers all night
9th heavy rain storm. Will Roberts left here for Galesburg
11th 99º getting in hay. A Son of Mr. Gabriels/Zogbrils fell into a thrashing machine and was torn [September 14] to pieces and Died in 2 minutes
12th drew in hay
13th beautiful morning very warm 96º sent letters to Electa Harding + Jewell & Gibson. Henry Gulon Died at Pekin Suicide by shooting - formerly coroner.
14th 97º finished haying
15th 100º again dreadful hot sun - began cutting oats
17th cooler
18th 56º quite cool Daisy sick at Mr. Dodds - finished harvesting to day
21st rainy [September 15] warm - Lester making wagon box. Daisy better
22nd splendid rain last night - wrm
25th Minnie(?)  come here to work - hoed out sweet potatoes & gardens - beautiful weather - Mrs. Thayer Died in Chinoa
1st August 1879 Lester Thrashed had 28 bu wheat 129-1/2 bu oats warm & dry
2nd hot weather  - Lull sick - Lester gone to Peoria with oats 96º
2d very warm. thunder

shower [September 16] went to church
3d fine rain from the North - rec'd Draft from Jewell & Gibson
4th fine thunder shower - warmer. Mr. Jno T. Gibson's wife Died - a wreckage at Chinoa
5th showers - thrashers obliged to quit
6th rain storm - got enough - but little oats stacked. Luther Emerson Died near Leadville - in a row + was shot twice - turned quite cool. went to Peiroa to get a Draft [September 17] cashed 56º
8th Mrs. Patu(?) visited here
9th 52º quite cool. Lester is going on a visit to Julia at Wyoming.  Mr. John Small Died in Deer Creek
9th visit to Mr. Kiscinger(?)
10th have to water our stock - very dry time
11th Lull stacked oats - at night thunder showers.  Bob Anderson's house burned
12th GDGibson took up one note
13th showers last night
16th 51º [September 18] cold
17th cold 46º have to water cattle
18th 46º clear - Mr. Newton Phillips wife Died in Bloomington - last friday
21st went to Groveland mill - 94º hot + very dry have to draw water for stock - sold 11-1/2 bu crab apples
22nd Lester shelled 400 bu corn - Nina sick with fever -hot weather
24th Mrs. Moses Morse Died - turned cool wind N.E. - great want of rain People have to dig for water

[September 19\
JW Glasgow Died in Pekin born 1805
30th Aug. went to Peoria with Marc - very dusty + warm - got home at 1 oclock - walked to Morton & loaned Dan. Habecker $200.00 - west cistern gave out - put pump in a well - great want of stock water
1st Sept Thunder & very little rain - very warm - afternoon fine shower
2nd Auditors meeting roads muddy - rc'd card from [September 20] Junius - Lester sowed winter wheat
4th quite sick all night & to day
5th 10º above freezing - Ann + Lester go to Tremont for Nanin
6th 40 yrs to day I was married to Ann Waters
7th fine showers roads muddy Mrs. Warren Willard Died last spring - in Galesburg. Mrs. Kipps(?) Died a few days ago
8th 10º above freezing - frost in places
9th 40º slight frost [September 21]
12th Rainy day
13th Nanin starts for Chinoa
14th 8º above freezing
16th very dry - great want of stock water. Mr Dodds & wife start east from Washington on a visit - very dusty
18th cool 40º F.W. Leonard Died in NY. of heart disease
22nd fine rain - not 1/2 enough
25th first killing frost at 32º - Lester & Chester Cole in Chicago
27th thunder showers good

Expect Lester home from Chicago
29th misty [September 22] Rev.   Allen & Dr. Cumbin(?) called here
1st Oct. Joel W. Clark Died aged 61 very warm & sultry
2d came home on the train from Peoria
3d attended funeral - he was buried in the Cemetery overlooking the Lake. Wm. Broyhill Died a few weeks ago
4th very warm 85º wells all going dry - Joan Dean & Ella visited here 86º hot - at 2 oclock 88º want rain very much
6th Charles [September 23] Burhans called here- very hot most 90º
7th rain storm - not hub(?) letter(?) - water fill
10th 88º in Peoria 95º 
12th still very warm has been very warm for several weeks & dry. Mr. Dodds + wife returned home yesterday
13th splendid rain last night. Still warm. S.R. Crosby Died a while since
14th Lester gone to Normal as Delegate Church
15th still very warm - apples all gone from the orchard
16th thrashed Buckwheat
17th fine rain [September 24] roads muddy
20th freezing - cool & clear
22nd cool wind Lull gathers his cider apples - Lester gets in a 100 bu corn a day - I took into the cellar our pumpkins & squashes
24th 7º below freezing - still very dry
25th 7º again. Jim Dean & Hayward visited. Mr. N.L. Woodruff Died in Peoria - ___ merchant - Delia Field Died
26th paid $5.00 for minutes for the year
29th I was sick all day
30th better to day cool & clear - stock water all drying up

1st Nov. 1879 15º below freezing - I was sick last night [September 25] very dry - Lulls stock well gave out - Rec'd a letter from Delaware Co. N.Y. very dry there springs & wells drying up
2d first snow fell last night over 1/2 in
4th election - 168 votes cast - Cooper had 8 majority - King(?) 8 maj. for surveyor
5th went to Horea(?) Tarbills to meet the Com.
6th made returns to Pekin Zack Chandler Died very suddenly - senator frm Michigan Mrs. Josep Huxtable Died on the 4th inst. in Salina Kansas
7th fine rain last night - joyfully received [September 26]
10th another rain storm. Gen. Joseph Hooker Died on the 1st Nov. rain every day now & very warm
13th Ann & I went to Peoria on a visit - very warm & muddy
14th Starch Factory burned visited around & returned home
17th another rain storm - N.E.
19th Finished gathering corn - clear & cool 7º below freezing
23rd Bible society at Morton - Rev. Harestion(?), Rev. Davis Ref. Brewster & Rev. Worthington took part in the exercises 9.08 collected officers elected [Septmeber 27] J.M. Robert Prest  Robert Roberts vice Prst Jas. Bradshaw sec Mr. Gruissel(?) Treas. Local agents school district No. Fred. Lohmier 2d Wm. Monroe 3d M.C. Waters 4 Wm. Smith 6 Junius Roberts 7 Mr. Pierce 8 Jos. Farlin
24th helped Lull draw in corn stalks and kill a pig(?) Henry Vaughns trial come off
26th Rain storm from SE - glad to see it
27th Thanksgiving day - the rain storm still continues
28th heavy rain last night - wind NW snow squalls.

1879
Wm. B. Merchant Died a while ago  Mr. Joseph [September 28] Birkett Died
30th colder - 14º below freezing clear roads very rough
31st Wind South hazy
1st Dec. clear & very pleasant day - warm. Gen. Geff. C. David Died
5th rain storm Lester plowing - corn stubble - warm
6th went to Peoria with Mark - drew Dividend from bank $120.00 very muddy
8th snow storm 6 in plump(?) ground muddy under
9th Birth day 72 yrs old - rain last night very foggy [September 29] Lester drives 2 hogs to Morton - gets 3.40 - Mark drives his hogs to Morton snow going off. Grant to be in Indianapolis - Ref. Dr. Wm. Ives Buddington Died at Brooklyn - very dense fog - and rain very gloomy & dark
12th 4º above zero
13th Anderson Son Died. Mrs. Garret Worthington Died recently
15th turned cold a norther squalls
17th snow squalls - Sent for youth companion & Lester's paper - Lester went to Peoria with chickens. Dr. Alonzo Stockwell Died a which(week?) ago [September 30] Ira Smith Died in Peoria aged 73
22nd began packing ice - 8 in thick
23d Sarah Clark is to visit here - I had a sick spell last night
24th visited Charles Waters - severe cold
25the Christmas 9º below zero
28th warmer. Mr.   Smith preached to us
29th Lester saws ice for Mark
31st hail + sleet all night - misty ground white with hail. Mrs. P.K.R. Brotherson Died on Christmas.

1880
1st Jan. foggy - trees covered with frost - vistited at John A - afternoon turned to a rain storm
2nd rained all night - foggy now
3d still foggy & dreary. mud etc
4th heavy shoers last night - muddy roads
5th rain again last night - foggy this morning
6th rain again last night & foggy still cleared off warm like a may day. bees flying
7th still foggy - Lester starts for Salina Kansas - went to Peoria on horse back - Loaned him $150.00 [October 2] he went on the T.P. & W. 
8th and foggy as usual Oh? when will it be over - roads horrid
9th thunder showers P.M. wind changed to N.W. cleared off
10th warm spring day
11th Asp(?) showers Oh how muddy
12th sent letter to Fannies(?) - cooler
17th went to Peoria with Marc - get a certificate of 100 on 2d National Bank sent receipt to Eworkarth(?) McClintock
18th Mr. Smith is to preach to us today - clear & south wind. Mr. John H. Harris Died in Tremont [October 3] Frank Leslie Died Nom Da Plum real name Henry Carter
19th rain storm 
20th cloudy wind NW - Mr. Saml(or Danl) Strumbaugh(or Sturnbaugh) Died. Wind S.E. looks like rain - gloomy weather - thunder showers
22nd snow squally - all day
23rd went to Morton fine day
24th spring weather
25th spring day- farmers plowing - roads drying up - went to Barnards.
26th visited Messingers - folks plowing

27th cold rain. [October 4] Mrs. Robert Small Died - a sister of Gov. Cullom - Mrs. Rev. C.C. Knowlton Died
29th thunder showers last night - turning cool again
31st 14º below freezing - clear - roads terrible rough. Ann had sick spell - turned warm wind South again
1st Feb. clear and cold - 14º below freezing - went to church
2nd cherr(clear?) - bad Candlemas day
3rd snow squalls from N.W.
4th went to Groveland
5th snow fell 2 in. last night
8th beautiful weather. Ann Sick - bad spell - Mr. W.B. Rinard Child Died. Mrs. ____ Wills(Wells?) Died an Aunt of Mr. Conlon(?)
11th thunder showers all day - 
12th clear & pleasant
17th wind South - warm. One year today Messinger's last babies Born - Lester + Mary started for Colorado
18th ground white with snow - rained nearly all night - girls come home last night
19th 12º above zero - clear - let Marc. have $60.00 to pay taxes - Old Mr. Jonas Farland Died of few days since
21st snowed a little last night
22nd went to Church and Messingers
23rd clear day - have a severe cold
24th am very hoarse. J.C. Rybolt Died in an Insane Assylums
25th thunder showers last night - robins Phebe birds in prairies chickens and frogs singing Spring like. Ann comes home - been gone a week - Mrs.    Shoemaker Died
28th rain storm - Mrs. Shoemaker buried to day - turned cold
29th 5 sundogs  in this month - had an invitation to Peoria but it rained so we could not go - snow squally - 12º above zero

Mar 1 1880 cool pleasant morning - sawed wood [October 7] sawed wood
3d rain storm muddy again - Loaned Mrs. McFarren(?) have $15.00 yesterday for a month
5th thunder showers - roads awful - finished sawing my wood pile - Lull went to mill at Hilton
6th went to Peoria - very muddy - Mrs. Barnes Died in Tremont
7th misty - 49 years to day I started from Missouri for home
10th snow storm
12th a cold N.E. wing(wind?) with snow flakes
13th met with Com. to district the town
14th 14º above zero - old Mrs. Horsing(?) Died
15th Hoffman child Died - buried here - Peter(?) Snores(?) Child Died also Aupurle lost(last?) 2 Children Died of scarlet fever. Measles & Scarlet fever very bad about here.
16th snow fell last night 1 in. - winter like. Dr. Brandreth Died in Sing Sing Sing measles + scarlet fever bad in Morton
19th Lester planted potatoes - Old Mrs. Rouse Died in Groveland
20th Benj. Ayers Died.
21st Mr. Smith has scarlet fever (slightly?) - Mr. Mc Cloud Died suddenly in Washington - Dr. B.C. K. Lucas Died of paralysis in Peoria
23d - Com. [October] meeting - scarlet fever + measles - very common
25th Rain storm mixed with snow
26th Rain Rain all day thunder showers
27th Equinoctial Rain storm - all afloat.
28th storm over 3 full days
30th Auditors meeting - pleasant day
31st Began sowing oats - sowed onions.
1st Apr. white frost clear & cool
2nd another rain storm
3d thunder & showers - John Shannon died a few days ago - over 90 yrs of age - 
4th fearful thunder storm all night - with hail in places

4th Apr. 1880 Paid $10.00 in subscription to Minister.
6th Apr. Town Meeting - Republican ticket all elected. Wm. Smith supervisor J.M. Robers clerk - Christ May assessor RB Renard col. CR Crandall Com. JWBrown Trustee of schools - turned quite cold
7th 7º below frozen
8th 4º below - clear - Lester finished owing oats yesterday
9th Lester sold 12 hogs
10th called Dr. Conibis - Ann sick all night
11th sent letters to Junius & Fanny - cold day 6º ___ NE wind
12th notified Peter F. Kensinger(?) of election to Bureau(?) of roads - went to Barnards
13th smokey & warmer - Lester goes to Atlanta - is delegate - Erastus has Scarlitana - quite sick
14th very high wind. peach buds out smoky roads getting dusty hot 81º
15th Anns birth day 62 yrs - thunder showers
16th rained all night - big rain good for grass etc.
18th after church thunder showers
19th heavy wind + thunder showers cool wind + heavy(?)
21st went to [October 12] Pekin to get assessment book & blanks - sent letter to W.M. Scott 80º hot
23d very heavy thunder shower - cooler now
24th terrible thunder storms . floods of water - streams - out of the banks - Com. of highways meeting - for levying road tax in the evening - terrible storm again and great damage done. Macking(Mackinaw?) out of the banks
27th Making out assessment for Roads
28th raining a little - Cherry trees in bloom.

1880
29th Apr. Rain storm last night quite cool today high wind N.W. - finished making out road papers
1st May Com. highway met + signed tax lists etc  pleasant day
3d put up 3 notices for Road Com. beautiful day people began planting corn. Rep. caucus in Pekin
5th Began planting corn.
7th Lester planting corn. Mary Lester's wife Died a year today - Fanny died 7 yrs ago today - every thing in leaf and bloom - beautiful scene 91º
8th thunder showers - warm terrible flood again - fearful thunder
9th muddy & cloudy  Ida Pratt Died a few days since - was married - some time since. Fearful thunder storms toward evening
10th another flood terrific thunder all night - water ran over the bridge - today more thunder showers - O! Dear the rain last night washed away 5 RR bridges  below here on the Midland RR and doing much damage elsewhere etc etc. - Mackinaw R.R. bridge on I.B.W. gone - so has farm creek Midland bridge gone
11th cooler.  Lester repairing bridge below here
15th cemetery meeting [October 15] Lewis Hourl(?) Died - Prest of 2nd National Bank Peoria
17th 250 Sweet Potatoes
18th Lull sick
19th thunder showers
20th rained all night - another long storm. Col. G.W. Baker Died - a Peoria Lawyer. Mrs. Col. D.D. Irons Died
25th Mr. Gibson called here so did Tomas Roberts & family
22nd find day - Mary here - Lester complaining
25th + 26th thunder showers
27th Lightning & thunder all night
28th sent letter to J.T. Roberts
29th great rain storm from NE cold

31st heavy thunder showers again Oh? Dear
1st June - fine [October 16] day - Lester built _____ sold load of hay to David Melville. WWWilcox Died Sup. of CB+Q RR- 
2nd National Rep. Convention - at Chicago - rec'd letters from Kansas
3d light rain storm
5th got dividend of 120 dollars - rainy windy
6th thunder and rain very high wind
7th Lester starts for Kansas after a wife - David Todd paid his note
9th Lester to be married this evening - to Maria Gillum in Kansas - terrible wind [October 17] storm with thunder + rain last night
10th 94º hot Barnums show in Peoria - Ex. Gov. Wood Died
11th 95º very hot Lester & wife come home
13th went to Church
14th heavy thunder showers
14th rainy - tax sales in Pekin
15th cold cloudy - W.B. Renard's daughter Died
17th Christ May assessor here - pleasant weather moneys and notes $1200 household $35.00 clock 1.00 total $1236.00 
21st fine weather - Dem. Convention first swamrs bees 2 come out today - hot sun 91º today
22nd 
23d 93º Ann & Children visited Mary Messingers some have harvested rye + clover hog seed
24th Insured my house for $700.00 for 5 years for $12.00 - rain storm
25th surprise party at Lesters - heavy rain last night. J.F. Roberts here yesterday
1st July - little rain cleared off beautiful weather - after noon a terrible thunder storm & wind. blew down apple tree + limbs from trees
3d celebrated Independence in our Grove. Foster delivered oration - I played the fife Lull + Polly John on the drum

4th at night very heavy thunderstorm Oh! O.
[October 19]
7th Began haying
8th rain storm again. Henry Tarbill Died suddenly of Scarlet fever
10th thunder showers
11th 93º very hot
12th pleasant day - Lester + Mark finish cutting hay - very hot - a little dusty 96º
14th very hot 96º finished haying - visited John A. he finished haying also. Lester stacked his wheat. Jo.(or Jr.?) Smith thrashed grain and hauled it to market
15th visited Charles Waters.  hot weather
16th cooler - morning 60º we have blackberries
17th went to Peoria - Jim. Hayward + wife start for Kansas
18th Sam'l E. Clark will start for Santafe tomorrow - slight thunder showers  [October 20]
19th thunder showers last night - muddy - great corn prospect.  Judge Charles Turner Died in Pekin of cancer in the stomach
20th commenced harvesting oats - cool 49º
21st still cool 52º Old Mr. Leonard Died in Morton. Judge Stephen T. Logan Died in Springfield
25th thunder showers last night - let Mary have $20.00 yesterday
27th put a lien(?) to Chicago for policy of Insurance - very warm - distant thunder
31st attended a political meeting at Groveland last evening
The 31st
[October 21]
Aug 1st very warm + dusty - want rain 
2nd heavy thunder shower with hail last night joyfully received. Cleared off beautiful
5th political meetings at Morton D.r Harris spoke Garfield Club - uniform - towards 50 - Mrs. Dea. Bascom Died a few days ago
10th thunder showers around - have to draw water for cattle - want rain very hot & dry - Elen Clark here
10th went to Deer Creek to a Political meeting - Rev. Gilmore speaker - very dusty
11th James Hampton Died in Morton - Mrs. Samantha Cornwill McCracken Died.

16th Mark Morse visiting here [October 22] Mrs. Parker Morse Died 5 weeks ago - sent $1000.00 to T.J. Roberts - Gibson city - 100º very hot - oh Dear
17th went to Tremont - visited George Hayward - Madam ___ Heilsson Died suddenly. Old Bull Died on the 18th
18th very hot and dry weather great wan of rain - stock water scarce
26th went to Tremont visited Charli Mathews - very hot
27th still hot - dust and no water Oh. Dear
28th fine rain last night - want more - P.M. heavy thunder shower
29th rainy - muddy roads - James Anderson Died killed accidentally at a barn raising of his own - I was present at his death - carelessness the occasion
31st Aug. James Anderson buried - masonic ceremony
1st Sept. fine rain last night - grass growing time
3d old settlers reunion in Glendale Park Peoria - looks too much like rain - heavy thunder showers - getting rain enough - Let John A. have $5.00
4th pole raising & Dedication of Wigwam in Morton - 4 speakers - great crowd
5th cooler - church sacrament to day
Sept. 7th Auditors met - political meeting at Deer Creek - Louis H. Case Died at Lincoln Neb. a few days since
8th returned 10.00 to Sam. Smith, burned morg. [October 24] 12º above freezing
9th 10º above field frosty
10th 9º slight frost in places - Lester thrashed his grain
10th rec'd on Conebear's Note 84.95 leaving now due 259.18
14th first killing frost 3º above freezing - sent letter to Junius, W.M. Scott & _T Gibson - very clear + cool
17th went to Peoria to deposit $800.00 getting warmer and dry - have to draw water for cattle again.
18th rain shower - warmer. T.N. Phillips is to speak in the Wigwam to night
20th threatens thunder showers - paid $10.00 on subscription.

24th Sept. [October 25] Started fro Indianapolis with wife + Nina - foggy & damp
25th visited the market water works got one trunk - the evenings - the drunk(?) beating(?) all over the city - Politics all the go
26th went to church. Rev. McCullock preached get wet in going to & from church - think we are having our Equinoctial storm.
27th fair begins to day - rainy & dismal - Sen. Bruce & Gov. Pinchback are to speak to night here - called on Charles Coe - went to English Opera house - saw Hamlet [October 26] played by Lawrence Barret - rainy wind
28 visited the Insane Assylum - over a 1000 inmates - the corner Stone of State House laid - Gov. Hendrix orator + Gov. Williams ordered the stone laid
29th cold + clear - visited the Telephone Factory etc.
30th frosty - last night went to the Theater
1st Oct - went to Insane Assylum
2nd went to the Stock yards etc.
3rd went to Methodist church - have sun [October 27] Sen. New + Gov. Kirckwood of Iowa at the Business Mens meeting at theWigwam
4th fine rain last night clear + pleasant. Tried to find Mr. English but he keeps hid in his private office
5th Democrats had a great day in torch light procession - 2 or 3 thousand in line - speaking by Gov. Hubbard of Texas , Gen. Mercer(?) of Michigan - Gen. Munson of New York & Frank Landers - candidate for Gov. - Senator Conklin from N.Y. here we saw Congressman(?) D.L. Matyr + wife on the train with us. Gen. Weaver spoke at the Circle - saw Gen. Bakerr

6th came home - Gov. Cullom spoke in Morton - great crowd out - from all around - 4 bands of Music torch light procession in company _____ get home in the evening all right 
7th cool - Lester picking corn - find it light
7th went to Lull's found him digging a cellar
8th appearance of rain
10th went to Pleasant Hill with Mr. Smith
11th warm - no killing frost yet - Dahlias in full bloom
Oct. 12th cool north wind smoky - Board of Registry met at Morton
15th visited Dodds & Smith
16th very high wind all night - turned quite cold - snow flying
17th boards white with snow - very chilly + cold
18th [October 29] 10º below frozen clear & cold
21st received school bonds $1000.00
22nd cold N. wind
24th 12º below freezing
25th wind south - Mrs. Anthony Field Died
26th a few drops of rain yesterday - cooler wind N.W.
1st I was at John A's he is sick
2nd Election for President fine day polled 250 votes - Rep. majority 43
3d cloudy appearance of rain - much needed - wells and cisterns getting dry all about - went to Pekin with the returns - fine rain storm all day visited at Mr. Burhans  - wells + cisterns nearly all dry [October 30]
7th communion Maria + Mrs. Anderson were united to the church + Mr. + Mrs. Smith __ had their 2 children christened
8th rainy - Chester Cole began his school - Lester plowing
9th sent letter to Hon. G. De Luc - Commissioner of Agriculture Washington D.C.
10th fine rain storm last night - road muddy - thankful
12th 10º below freezing - clear
14th 16º above zero flakes of snow falling
15th snow storm - winter like - took onions into the cellar + banked house ready now for winter.

19th Nov. 1880 down to 0º Zero - very clear - George Wood + Eva Sill married last evening
20th 1º above zero wind S. clear
21st went to Peoria yesterday got $120.00 dividend, deposited $640.00 in bank very cold
22nd 5º below zero - clear - splendid roads - Blue Jeans Williams Gov. of Indiana Died
23rd zero- Naffinger paid interest - Lester gone to Peoria pleasant day - Lucretia Moth Died a few days ago
24th snow storm - Lydia Maria Child Died short time ago - Lint. Mooberry's child Died and buried to day
25th snow storm in the morning cleared off pleasant
26th guess the cold spell - broken
27th every thing white with post (snow?)
Dec. 1st a little more snow - the Girls gone to Mr. Dodds - sent letter to John T Gibson - Ann & Maria gone to Nat Snuffins(?) - Mr. Cliver of Tremont Died
2nd fine winter weather - Mr. Isaac Walker Died in Peoria - Warehouse(?) dealer
4th foggy - want rain very much water very scarce - Nell Loomis Died in Kansas - married to James
5th rain last night - wind shifted + blew fearfully - fences blown down - turned cold 10º above zero - paid $10.00 to preacher
7th snow storm 5º below zero - snow fell 2-1/2 in.
8th cleared off - 2º above zero - winter like.
9th Dec. 1880 Birth day 74 yrs old - very cold 10º below zero 
10th 6º below zero
11th went to Peoria cloudy
12th snow squalls
17th hail rain + snow storm Wilson W. Campbell Died in Morton - Jeb. Hadges Died
22nd still cloudy - for a week past; cloudy all the time last night - Ladies fair + supper at Morton
23rd visited John A's - cloudy as usual
24th going on 2 weeks of cloudy + misty weather
25th Christmas - snow storm - a few inches - Joseph Strickfaden Died - horses gone away threw him off + broke his neck.

Ep attorney general. Ackerman Died in Georgea [November 1] David Proctor Died Peoria
27th turned very cold at 0º zero wind N.W. was at Marks yesterday found John quite sick
28th 12º below zero - frost flying
29th 20º below zero - sun dogs - no one stirring on the roads
30th 4º below zero - wind gone down. Ann & I been sick - a little better to day
31st 12º below zero - wind south. Dr. Chapin Died in New York  George Eliot Died in England a novelist
1st Jan. 1881 - Ann & I sick yet - pleasant day - up to freezing
2nd pleasant day 8º above zero
3d 3º below zero - R.R. men clearing away the wreck just below here - 8 cars smashed up & off the track. George D. Gibson came here - let him have [November] $2,000.00
4th 9º above zero - moderate winter weather
7th 8º below zero - clear - Papers state the oranges froze on the trees in Florida - At Galveston Texas the water pipes bursted from freezing - Charles Roberts broke his leg nearly by a sled load of wood last tuesday falling on him.
8th slight snow fall 4º above  Mathew Craig Died in Wohshigles(Washington?) a lawyer ag 72 - Widow Wilson Died near Deacon street
10th 20º below zero 26º at Lulls - clear sunshine
11th 5º below
12th Lull sick. Ellen come here - thawing some
13th I don't mend much. most discouraged - turns cold and snow squall from the N.W. wrote my Will again
14th 18º below zero clear etc.
15th snow storm - __all as usual
16th snow storm again 4 in. deep - greatest storm for a long time - stock water nearly all gone Oh! Dear - I am still sick - but a little better
17th good sleighing at 0º cold - 
18º 3º above zero - sent letter to W. M. Scott - Lester & Wife go to Levi Mathews on a visit
20th 3º above zero again - Lester sold 8 hogs & went to Groveland Mill - cloudy all day
21st Ann went to see Lull's folks
22nd sent letter to G.T. Gibson - Lester sawed wood for ______

23d snow squalls - good winter weather - water famine in Galesburg ... Charles Waters sick with cold
24th Lester sawed his wood pile - sent letter to Junius - snow squalls
25th snow squalls again
26th 2º above zero - very bright sun dogs - Lester gone to Dodd's saw wood
27th 2º below zero - clear + very cold
28th 10º below zero - my back still very lame
29th snow + mist - Lester killed 2 hogs
30th thawed all night 2º above frozen a real spring morning. Gen. Asahel Gridley Died last money in Bloomington
31st misty from S.E. Wm. Bradshaw Died
Feb. 1st cleared [November 5] off - trees covered with ice
4th 0º zero clear
7th showery all night water rainy in the yard the well back of the house full. The dam full the water famine over I think 
8th raining all day and foggy
9th still raining - snow nearly all gone
11th snow storm hail + rain
12th great snow storm
13th 13º above zero snow over 6 in deep + very heavy snow - Thomas Carlyle Died in Scotland - James Gove Died at Washington of catar_h(?) - Lester sold 26 hogs for $180.00, --?
14th 11º below zero - Lester went to Peoria so did John A & family also Mark Messinger, all 3
15th snows again [November 6]- Gen    Love Died in Indianapolis
16th 2º below zero clear sun shiny day
17th 1º above - company yesterday & today afternoon began to snow - bids fair to be a great storm
18th snow fell about a foot deep so now we have 18 in. on a level - pretty well - James Sawyer Died in Vineland N.Y.(N.J.?) - Fernando Wood Died
19th 2º below zero - sun shiny
20th 6º above trees white with frost - went to church - first since before Christmas - Peter Unzecker Died - went to his funeral on 22nd

22nd sent letter to J.T. Roberts & McClintock - thawing fast
23rd James Goodyear of Burhham visited here. settled with Peter F. Kunsinger
24th 2º above zero - Wm. Truesdale(?) Died in Peoria suddenly of heart disease
26th thunder showers - water all over the ground - went to Peoria
27th still thawing - all muck - Matt H. Carpenter Died at Washington a senator from Michigan after noon snow storm
1st March 1881 4º above zero good sleighing 
2nd wife of George W. Davison Died 2 days ago - George J. Dodds is to be married this evening to Ellen Webb
3d lightning & rain last night - today a snow storm - high wind - snow in drifts [November 8]
4th Inauguration of Garfield as President - snow squally still 16º below freezing
5th snowed all day + night yesterday - some clear this morning 20º above zero
6th clear beautiful day - good sleighing yet by snow drifts - Received a letter from Orville Phelps of Oregon
8th snow fell 2 in last night thawing this morning
11th rain storm- snow + hail - all day
12th rain last night + very foggy this morning
13th Alexander II of Russia assissinated Died
14th clear sun shine paid Ministhe(?) $10.00
15th went to Peoria drew out of bank $1100.00 - in coming home - in trying to help a woman over the creek - the horses [November 9] got in quicksand and come very near loosing one horse - got wet + a terrible time of it.
16th rain and thunder - raining this morning and awful muddy - the Zar of Russia Died by assassination - Mr. Foster Died in Peoria - loss to the Church - Mr. Pinckney Died - Mrs. Hutson Died 
19th great snow storm from NE all day
20th snowed all day and still snowing - it is very damp from a foot to 1-1/2 ft. Trains blocked.

March 21st 1881 snow fell 14 in on level [November 10] Lesters hired man began work to day
26th Town caucus
27th Methodist quarterly meeting in Morton
28th great snow banks roads very muddy
29th Auditor meeting snow in big drifts
30th very cold wind 10º below freezing
31st March had a call from the Deputy Marshal for $300.00 on a Judgement from Payson for the Defendant Republic Fire Insurance Co. which I refuse to pay to a set of swindlers - another great snow storm. Nina has the mumps. [November 11]
1st Apr. cold winter like 18º above zero snow fell 2 or 3 in. and drifted - block trains again. William Mitchell Square Cruk(Creek?) Boise City Idaho - Went west in 1852. Abner Mitchell Died 5 yrs ago. Rev.    Benedict Died Died Mrs. WC Bartlit Died a short time since
Apr. 3d snows every day gloomy time for farmers - winter like Oh? Dear  Col. Fred Huker Died in St. Clair Co. [November 12] 
4th sun comes out a little - Lester goes to Peoria to market
5th Town meeting - got home near 12 oclock - cold wind polled 216 votes I got 208 for town clerk being the 22 year of continuous service
6th made returns to Pekin - clear and cool
8th Frank Roberts _ Caleb Harding visited here - rain storm last night - lots of snow banks yet
11th rain storm with thunder + lightning
12th very heavy thunder + rain last night - another snow storm Oh? Dear?
14th 10º below freezing.

15th Anns birth day 63 yrs old [November 13]
16th first spring morning - planted early potatoes -lettuce onions peas rashishes etc
18th Lester began sowing oats - cloudy wind NE
19th Clerked for Com.  Lord Baconfield(?) Died
21st fine rain storm - I am making out road papers for the Com. of highways. Daisy has the mumps. John W. Casey Died in Pekin - came there in 1832
28th showery went to Morton for beef 15cts per lb. pail $5.00 to Smith on subscription
30th met with Com. to close up the road tax papers
1st May thunder showers all night but little rain in large drops [November]
4th rain storm
5th planted late potatoes - trees leaving out - Dr. Shaw Died in Gamse(?) a fine ___ day
8th warm growing time - James T. Field Died publisher in Boston; John G. Darby Died Engraver in New York; John G. Palfrey Died Historian N.York; William Lawton Died Blackberry(?) man
11th Frank Stevens Died in Morton 90º extremely hot - people planting corn
12th thunder showers
13th Lester began planting corn - wet + muddy
14th terrible thunder showers last night [November 15] + hail storm - a thunder shower to day = bad for farmers
15th turned cool
18th 47º churned(?) 3 ___
27th yesterday morning Cousin O K(H?) Coc's wife Died in Indianapolis. Ann & I went visiting in Peoria we got wet in coming home. thunder showers. To day Lester + nina with Mark and his boys went to Peoria to Forepaugh's Circus + Menagerie - Col. Thomas A. Scott Died on the 21st - the RR King.

May 28th Lester went to mill with 12 bu wheat
31st Lester [November 16] Charles & I took up the bones of (father-in-law?) Luther Waters + his wife and buried them in Roberts cemetery - very hot. thunder showers last night + will be to night + this afternoon heavy thunder showers - plenty rain now every thing growing finely
4th cool 47º 
5th heavy thunder shower with hail this morning - First strawberries
6th fearful thunder storm all night Farmers have to lay by - for mud - Lester brot. home 4 corn grinders for sales
7th Terrible thunder showers all night again Oh? Dear -
8th Thunder + Lightning as ever last night mud + water - cisterns running over
10th Saturday 
11th started for Bloomington - went to Minier(?) changed cars the CIA to Bloomington - started from Morton at 24 minutes past 7 oclock and arrived at Bloomington at 9:30 Ina Burhans' new wife knew me - at night thunder showers as usual went to Church afterwards went to Dr. Rogers and at night thunder and lightning as usual with high wind - a fire through 105 ___ rod all on Bloomington for the water works and around(?) Judge Davis reading(?)
12th went to church - after to Dr. Rogers- went to the water works thunder storm at night.
13th another thunder Terrible destruction by Cyclone a host through Kansas, Iowa & Ills. went on top of the water standpipe water stands 200 ft in the shaft a beautiful view in all directions for 20 miles or more - I counted 284 steps on a sirus(?) form

arrived at home found all well - dreadful cyclone [November 19] in Kansas & Iowa - destruction of life + properties
14th thunder storms again - farmers discouraged too wet to work
15th 94º very hot a haze coming up front NW
18th Mark + I went to Peoria saw Coup's Manarzrin (Menagerie?) + Circles (Circus?) - thunder showers
19th thunder showers as usual - Minne Hoffman Died day before yesterday - formerly a hired girl of ours
20th + 21st thunder showers 52º NE wind - misty - began plowing corn 3d time [November 20]
22nd 13º above freezing cold weather - several sick in Morton
23rd first swarm of Bees. Mr. Osborn visited here 
24th cool mornings
25th paid to minister $5.00 - thunder shower
27th correcting assessment Roll
28th terrific thunder + lightning all night Personal Property $103163 Dogs(?) 177
29th thunder showers
30th rain storm rain every day - good only for pastures
1st July pleasant day 
2d do  went [November 21] to morton
4th July 81 very pleasant day went to Washington + visited Mrs. George D. Gibson - celebration in the grove. Worthington oration of the day - great many people - News from Washington D.C. gloomy - Prest. Garfield in a critical condition.
Attempted assissination of the President by a Frenchman on the at the Depot

5th July Lester began cutting wheat very hot 94º [November 22] 
6th very hot night - today 96º thunder showers around 
7th 96º again had swarm bees - found(?) oats etc.
8th 96º
9th 97º fait - most melted - Garfield better think he will recover sent letter to Junius
10th 93º at 6 oclock it was 90º Oh Dear we shall all perish. 50 years ago today I was in Buffalo NY on our way to Illinois
12th 95º still hot as ever - getting very dry  - Lull laid by his corn [November 23] afternoon 98º blood heat towards night thunder showers - hay gets wet
14th rainy day - lot of how out Lull's wheat lies unbound - rained all the forenoon hard - with thunder and lightning. Cisterns all full. W.H. Richmond Died in Peoria of heart disease
15th foggy - poor haying - much will be spoiled
16th finished haying - very hot 96º 
17th thunder showers [November 24]
20th helped John A harvest his wheat - very hot 92º
21st thunder showers - helped Lester bind oats 92º
22nd finished cutting oats a little cooler
23rd Looks like dry weather - sent card to Gibson
24th very pleasant morning Rev. Longley is to preach 63º
26th cool 58º Lester cuts Lull's oats today
27th I was sick all night - clear beautiful weather - wrote to ARR and Orvill Phelps

Justice(Justin?) Clifford Died one of the Supreme [November 25] Judges
30th Daisy nearly killed by the wagon loaded with oats ran over her & broke her thigh and collar bone and nearly crushed her head
1st Aug. 93º clear + very dry - Daisy - a little better - but not out of danger of congestion of the brain
2d - sent letter to Jewell & Gibson - an only son of Horace Tarbill Died aged 12 yrs [November 26] - Daisy is some better - hot again 96º - sent letter to Junius - very dusty
3d 96º again 
4th 100º burning sun stacked oats - Mark helped - Dr. ____ Dayse (Daisy) leg
5th wrote to Moira Dayton(?) 99º a little wind to day
6th fine shower - thankful - Daisy better 94º
7th cooler. Ann Sick
8th George Roberts - visiting from Indianapolis hot again 98º at noon
11th 100º Oh Dear
12th went to [November 27] Peoria and back at 11 oclock hottest day of the season 101º every thing burning up - Orville Grant Died also Bishop Haver Died - I was on a jury on a Road trial yesterday the 11th - O'Briens were allowed from 250 to 260 dollars damages each
13th a blessed rain storm every thing now looks cheerful
14h 58º on the money
16th went to Groveland on calls. Mr.  OBrien very feeble

17 Aug. 1881 cool 58º in the morning - Began fall plowing yesterday 92º at 4 pm [November 28]. In Spain the springs & rivers dried up - terrible suffering - Gen. Robert Patterson Died in Philadelphia - Hon. O.H. Browning Died in Quincy - Capt. Wm. A. Hall Died in Peoria an old settler - the Prest. worse fears of his death - Cephas(?) Wood Died in California - 
19th Daniel Roberts visiting here from Iowa
26th Born a Son to L.B.R. named _____________ hot again 96º great want of rain - stock water getting scarce [November 29]
28th 97º Oh how dusty
29th George starts for home. I went to Tremont then to Pekin - high wind - better news from Garfield
30th hot 94º Oh? Dear?
31st Daniel Roberts starts for Iowa - all appearance of rain has vanished - dust every where - very hot night
1st Sept warm appearance of showers 94º
2nd foggy + rain with thunder Harriet Emerson here [November 30] 
3d got spectacles on trial of Dr. Combear(?)
4th last night a heavy thunder shower - {Smith assigned as Pastor of church [stricken]} - very thankful - everything brightening up 94º hot as ever
5th thrashing to day high wind 96º
6th Auditors meeting 96º again
7th 94º slight shower
8th Old Settlers meeting in Peoria looks like showers so I stay at home - very warm - John Harris Died at Tremont on the 5th 
9th cooler no rain

Sept. 10 fine thunder shower - Mark + Mary [December 1] here - after noon Mark went to Peoria and I to Morton - appointed committee to join Churches with Tremont
11th I am sick so didn't go to Church - Smith resigned as pastor of the church  - cool 42º stock water now plenty
12th 46º Barnum's great show in Peoria - Maria no better
13th 50º clear
15th rainy Mark is to thrash to day - Gen. Ambrose E. Birnside Died in Rhode Island
16th still rainy - colder & misty
17th cool + clear 42º Church meeting. Ref. F.H. Smith's resignation accepted
18th clear pleasant morning 48º Maria sitting up and dressed.  last week snow fell 2 ft deep at Deadwood - and some fell in northern Iowa
19th President Garfield Died at Long Branch at last at 10 oclock P.M. 
20th Anson Gillum married to Angie Osborn
21st Mark + Mary here to day - I am some sick - hot weather again 90º
22nd warm still
24th high S. wind 90º dust flying - heavy thunder shower - furious wind - fences blown down
25th warm beautiful morning - a memorial services in OBrien's grove for the churches for the dead President 90º
27th rainy - bad Fair day - yesterday funeral services at Morton for the President Lorenzo Delmonica Died this month in New York.
29th 86º very windy - Began picking winter apples.

Sept. 30/81 fine rain storm great great crowd yesterday at the Fair [December 4] bad to day - looks like a rainy day
1st Oct. finished picking apples. Johnson Cronwell & Charles Cornwell's wife visited here - rainy
2nd great rain storm all night - our big cistern at the barn caved in - Mr. F.H. Smith preaches his farewell sermon today - very muddy
3d still warm + rainy - mud, mud
4th still raining - wind in the N.E.
5th 40º Clear and cool - Lester's apples all gathered 208 bu. 190 bu cider apples sold $50. worth - [December 5] - paid Rev. F.H. Smith let Lester have $34,00 for Smith
6th Fanny visiting here I am sick to day
7th warmer - looks like storm again
8th heavy thunder showers - warm
9th clear and cooler -
10th went to Peoria - sent $50.00 to Junius. The Pink eye has broken out in Peoria a diseases in horses. several have died
11th Rev. Smith & Austin Harding families visited here
12th rain storm last night + today
13th heavy rain all night - misty [December] cooler 59º
14th another heavy rain last night Oh? Dear when shall we have good weather again
15th heavy rain last night again warm this morning 70º Oh how muddy showery all the fore noon - wind changed to N.W. getting cooler - Orson Pratt Died mormon elder - a few days ago
16th rain all last night - no end to it - Dedication of Methodist Church at Groveland
17th lightning - heavy showers as usual
18th dug potatoes
19th first frost - Mrs. Borgandis Died at Deer Creek - Old Mr. James Robeson Died.

20th Oct. 1881 cloudy - horrid roads
22nd got in my potatoes 8 bu.
23d rain again 
24th rain all night + today Oh? dear - what roads - 
26th clear pleasant day 40º in morning
27th dug Lesters potatoes 10 bu
28th Rain storm again - killing a hot
29th Thunder showers last night Baron Roschild Died
1st Nov. Foggy damp morning - horrid muddy roads no killing frost yet - Farmers busy husking corn
2nd Rain + fog - Lesters hired man discharged - Let Lester have $17.00 [December 8] out of $20 gold piece = Paid
3d cold 1º above freezing - put up wire fence
6th went to church - Rev. Cary preached
7th misty 
10th sick at the stomach and disy(dizzy)
11th N.E. rain storm cold and dreary
13th first snow flakes - S. wind - awful muddy - Dr.    Martin M.D. Died in Peoria a few days since
15th 14º below freezing Lester sold his hogs 27 in No. $403.
16th Lester finished gathering corn Wind Southern 38º [December 9]
17th Rain again this evening at 6.30 Mr. Mowray marries Miss Mirsi-- Cornwell at E.J. Cornwell's residence
18th Rain all the time - sleet - very disagreeable weather 
19th every thing covered with ice
20th 17º wind shifted S. Thomas Webb sr. Died
23rd turned cold - Mr. Kaisinger(?) came here
24th thanksgiving - very cold 10º above zero -- Mr. Webb berried in an Iron casket weighing 400 lb.

30th Nov 1881 sent letters to Orville Phelps - to ABRoberts + to Mina Dayton - warm and thunder showers
Dec. 1st cloudy + cooler - snow last night - very muddy roads
2nd frosty + foggy - Last Sunday John M. Gipps Died of heart disease
3d still foggy 
4th still cloudy and dismal - 20 yrs. ago today Ellen died - Dr. Perkins Died in Tremont - Thaddeus Smith Died yesterday - Mr. Rowell Died
5th clear beautiful morning - Lester goes to Deer Creek on a visit to A. Gallums(?)
6th still cloudy
9th Birth Day - party - beautiful day
10th clear + frosty 16º above zero - went to Nat Sniffins(?) visiting
11th ground white with snow - 1-1/2 in. - Old Mrs. Hayward Died just before thanksgiving day
12th rain last night - mud & water again
13th rainy all night every thing afloat
14th cold 10º below freezing - Lucia Burhans married to ___ Goodyear at 3 P.M. - John W. Forney Died
17th Approved Collection Bond - over(?) $22000
18th cool and frosty 5º below freezing -        Stevens Died very suddenly at Dr. Conibers - he arrived only the evening before from Washington Territory
20th rainy night Oh. the roads
21st rain
22d still raining - no bottom to roads - Gen. Kilpatrick Died - a famous cavalry officer
25th Christmas - a pleasant day - I went to Church on foot

[December]
27th foggy - Lester plastering his house
29th turned cold - snow squalls
30th 15º below freezing - ground white
Jan. 1st - 1882 - Junius visiting here.  John OBrien Died new Groveland last monday - aged 86
2nd ground white with snow - pleasant however Junius starts for home
4th snow storm
6th killed 3 hogs - warm & thawing
7th rainy + misty
8th rain last night - Churek (church?) communion. AW Stewart [December 14] & wife joined the Church - very muddy - turning cold
10th looks like a storm snow fell 2-1/2 in.
11th - winter like but warm 2º above freezing
12th Rain storm last night -foggy to day
15th Diadama Roberts Died was found dead in bed
17th 1º below zero. Dama. Roberts buried to day I was not able to attend the funeral
18th 8º below zero Lester helps Mark fill ice house
20th filled Ice house
21st rain last night - Thrashed clover seed
22d 10º [December 15] above zero
23d paid taxes $31.15 - cold day 8º above zero
24th 17º above
25th killed a beef and went to Peoria rainy Sent a Postal to Boston
26th very foggy very muddy
27th clear froze some
29th 2º above zero - clear - staid at home - Clerkson N. Potter Died of NY.
30th 13º above zero - wind South - Lester had a tooth pulled
Feb. 1st went to Pekin - went to Morton - pleasant
2nd visited Lull. pleasant weather Festival to night at Morton

4th Feb. 1882
[December 16]
Sent 1000. dollars by Express to Vivian Cloud + B.F. Geigher(?) - El Paso
5th went to Church - very pleasant weather for several days
7th visited Robert Roberts
9th wrote to E.L. McClintock - sent a receipt of $80. interest
11th went to Peoria with Mark - came home in the rain.
12th roads muddy - wrote to Betsy Ann 70º
13th heavy thunder showers last night - pleasant to day
14th Valentine - spring weather
15th 2º above freezing [December 17] Robins & Blue Birds singing
16th Rain last night
17th Mrs. Tilly McClollem(?) visted Lesters on her way to Kansas.  Farmers plowing wind N.E.
20th great rain storm & Sleet
22st went to Pekin - staid at White H__
23d Proved Diama's Will - then went to Peoria - visited Sarah Clark then went to Mr. Emerson then to George Emerson staid all night and returned home the 24th - an old settler    Adams Died in Fon Du Lac also old Mrs. Cole Died
25th Rain again
27th rainy all day
28th heavy thunder and rain all night - still raining - great flood [December 18]
1st March - Clear + pleasant 2º above freezing a spring morning - after a bid rain.
2nd 5º above freezing after noon 66º
3d Thunder showers off South - Lester gone after lime for plastering
6th Anson Gillum Died in Kansas aged 88 yrs - Old Mr. Duncan Died - in Deer Creek
8th went to Lull's - cool wind -
9th rain storm all night & to day - terrible floods in the south. A.C. Rouse Died in Metamora aged 83 yrs - Henry Wilson Died our Vice President
10th ground white with snow 5º below freezing roads no better - Oh Dear?

sent letters to Junius - ABR - Orville Phelps [December 19] & to Ina Burhans
12th 2º below - very muddy - went to Church
13th 20º above zero - clear - 
14th 24º   '   '   Wind south hazy
15th 2º thunder + rain last night - Prof. White of Peoria Died - David Eaton Died in Tremont age 78
17th thunder showers - all day
18th cloudy & damp 54º O? what roads
19th Sunday afternoon began to rain again
20th rain storm all night then thunder showers till morning then settled into a big rain storm and of flood Oh. Dear.
21st A Blizard [December 20] fearsome wind with snow squalls - Com. of Highway make Report
22nd 20º below freezing - Lester & Daisy go to Dodds on foot
23d 2º below freez. went to Groveland - George Kettelle Died once Co. Clerk of Peoria
24th 12º below freezing - Great floods on the Ohio and Mississippi thawed boy drowned
25th getting warm - looks like showers - Planted first potatoes - sowed onions - Litt___ caucus to day - Republican - did not go to it.
26th beginning to rain again
27th Thunder showers all night - awful weather
28th Town Auditor meeting - beautiful day [December 21] Henry Wadsworth Longfellow Died last Friday - Clarissa Smith Died at Buford - Mrs. Montross Died
Apr. 1st 1882 beautiful spring day - planted early potatoes - communion to day tomorrow
2d Rev.   Rose preached - he is on his way to Belfast Ireland with his wife - staid to every person - Rev. Orville Dewy Died unitarian preacher

USA Minister Hurlbut Died in Peru [December 22]
Apr. 4th 1882 Town meeting
Alex Moobery Supervisor with 46 majority
Jno M. Roberts Town Clerk 23rd term 41 "
Christ. May assessor                           21 "
J.K. Oswald  collector                          37  "
Chas. Waters Com. of highway            12  "
T.C. Smith  school trustee                     22    "
7th Mary & John A folks visited us - plowed east garden - planted peas etc etc made soap - peach trees in bloom
8th made [December 23] returns of election to Co. Clerk
9th heavy thunder showers - foggy this morning
10th rained all night - turned cold NE wind 0º freezing - afraid peachs are killed
11th clear & cold 8º below freezing - Sam'l Clark called here - of Santa Fe New Mexico
13th 2º below freezing - fear the fruit is killed - Mr.  Getsinger Died in Morton - of hemorage - Myron Messinger Died - a brother to Messinger
15th Ann's Birth day 64 yrs old 4º below freezing
16th 2º above - sprouted potatoes
19th Took Maggie to Tremont on her way home it rained all the way here muddy roads again her fare was $3.35
22d clerked for Com. of highway - high wind
23rd rain, rain, wind & mist & mud, mud - ____ WH Crane Died in Washington
24th 2º above freezing 
26th Thunder showers last night. Lester shells corn to day
30th 32º freezing - cold 2 ft snow in Dacota - Darwin Died - (the scientist) - James B. Roberts Died in Jacksonville Florida of consumption (the last of Mar.

May 1st 1882 thunder shower cool began [December 25] town(?) writing
2nd Austin Harding Died suddenly this morning - funeral thursday at 11
4th yesterday rain storm - muddy - attended the funeral today very hot day
5th thunder showers all night & this morning
6th cool rain + mist all day - Gloomy time
7th still cloudy & misty
8th rain again - Ralph Waldo Emerson Died
9th rain last night
10th rain
11th rain rain - Lester goes to John A after some plaster - finished road [December 26] papers - total credits 26895 "[total] per prop. 101163 for 1881 - Dogs(?)  177
12th N.E. rain storm Oh Dear when will it stop raining
13th still raining - glomy time
14th went to Church - muddy - heavy fall of snow in Georgia)
16th 1º above freezing - yesterday it was 6º above ice in the trough - killed potato tips - Ex. Gov. C.C. Washburn Died
21st cool 12º above freezing
22nd 5º above freezing
23d 10º above Amelia Bartlet Died
25th went to Peoria-big rain storm yesterday -  Sells & Brothers big show in Peoria [December 27] 
26th rain again with thunder showers - Martin Messinger Died suddenly
27th rained all night great flood - the dam washed away - rained all day again
28th still raining - Oh. Dear. will it never stop - funeral to day of Messingers
30th sent letter to O. Phelps W. Mitchell AB Roberts and Fanny Roberts - a little rain + looks like more - Rev. W. T. Adams Died at El Paso a few days since
31st rain last night - visited UH Crosby's - misty rain rain etc

1882 Apr. Minister Hurlbut Died in Peru [December 28]
June 1st 1882 - cool 42º clear. Enoch Emery Died in Peoria Editor of the Peoria Transcript formerly -- 
2d rainy day again. Oh. Dear. will it never stop raining - poor prospects for corn. Mud all over
3d rained all night + this morning - growing cold - awful muddy roads
4th 47º slight showers
7th Prof. Williams called here - is tracking(teaching?) writing
8th Thunder showers - poor night for festival - Rev. Wm. J. Allen Died at Geneseo [December 29] Guiseppe Garibaldi Died the Patriot - born 1807 - 22d June - 
9th heavy thunder showers again farmers discouraged - planting corn not done
10th looks like rain - warm - shower upon shower. What is to become of us
11th heavy rain all night - cooler now
13th went to Morton + to Mark Messingers - heavy thunder showers all the time Oh Dear
16th terrible thunder storm with large hail
17th fearful night - constant lightning
18th another frightful night of Electricity - a constant glare of lightning - awful
19th John + Charles Gibson were here
20th cloudy am rain
21st fearful thunder storm all night a flood - Col. Charles H. Dean Died of Peoria - Gov. Denison of Ohio Died
23d - another fearful thunder storm all night, dreadful discouraging time - Thermometer yesterday up to 90º
25th another terrible thunder storm last night Oh Dear. what is to become of us.

David Todd preached to day thunder showers again - one after the other - every thing afloat
26th corrected assessment roll - heavy thunder storm again last night
27th heavy thunder storms continue as poor Mr.    Sterling Died (Mrs. Canibears(?) father)
28th thunder showers
29th thunder showers all night - gloomy time - mud every where
30th Guito[Guiteau] is to hung(hang?) today - I hope there there will be a change in the weather looks very threatening for rain - heavy shower - rec'd letter from Orville Phelps
1st July - light showers
2nd pleasant day
3d thunder storms again gloomy time
4th July - began harvesting Rye - very wet and muddy - cannon roaring around
5th clear as a Bell - for a wonder - heavy dew - 53º cool.
6th helped(?) (Harvesting?) Rye
7th rained day - Lesters hired man left - horray weather again - terrible cyclones in Pennsylvania - great floods every where 
9th communion season - heavy rain - all afloat again Oh. Dear
11th 62º Hired Man Silos commenced work
12th thunder showers off Sun(?) come up clear, good
13th 57º cooler - Lester goes to Mill - Began haying - slight thunder showers
14th pleasant day
16th rain storm last night
17th set out Strawberries
18th fine rain last night
20th - 48º clear - Mrs. Abraham Lincoln Died in Springfield last saturday of Apoplexy.

21st July 1882 - Mrs. Ogden Died - a daugther of WW Campbell - cool 53º
25th Beautiful weather now - Farmers are now busy some plowing out corn others harvesting and still others thrashing - I went to see Barnard
24th clear and dry - shall want rain soon - Lester sick in bed
25th went to Pekin - Joshua Wagensiller(?) Died in Pekin - Sam'l R. Mooberry Died
29th visited Marry Messinger - Mark is in Nebraska travelling
30th gentle rain storm - very glad to see
31st Emma Moobery Died 
1st August - attended funeral - thunder showers 
2d-3d thunder showers every day - Roofs Barn burnt by lightning
4th misty + wet
5th thunder showers all around as usual
6th thunder showers every afternoon
7th Aug. Paid LBR $50.00 and Dr. Conibear(?) $2.30 - thunder showers again.
9th cool 54º change of weather
10th 49º very clear. Began stacking oats
11th 49º 
15th thunder showers
16th Co. convention - sabbath school - thunder showers last night - shelling corn for Funk
21st Silas Winklepuk(?) called for his Deeds - and left - getting very dusty - want rain - 
Aug. 23d paid Conibear $180.00 - fine shower last night - Borrowed of Augusta Roberts $40.00
24th thunder showers
25th Lester pulverizing(?) his oat stubble
27th heavy shower - roads muddy.

Aug. 28 Mr. Gerber had all his grain in stacks burnt by lightning
29th thunder showers around every day - Paid LBRoberts $50.00 on Aug. 30th
1st Sept big rain storm - Lester clearing(cleaning?) out cistern
3d Thunder shower last ni__(night?)
5th Auditors meeting - An excursion to Dacota(?) start from Morton
11th Junius(?) school begins - fine weather now
12th paid subscription of $10.00 - cool mornings(?)
13th went to Peoria - staid all night
14th attended Old Settlers reunion at Glen Dale Park - very dusty
15th David Todd here - finished cementing(?) Cistern
18th 90º very hot
19th trying to rain
21st cold 43º made some cider - but few apples - shall go to A. Goodyears on a visit
22nd first frost - 35º dug sweet potatoes
23rd Maria confined - a Boy - lived a few hours only
24th 5º above freezing - very dusty
26th went to Peoria - went all over the Fair grounds - staid all night at George Emerson
27th took the IB+W train for Indianapolis arrived at 8 oclock found my way to Junius
28th attended the State Fair of Indiana
29th thunder showers went to the Court house + reception of the 26th Indiana regiments reunion
27th walked about the city in the evening and called on Mr. O'K.Coc
30th attended the Congregational Church in the A.M. in the evening to the Presbyterian Church
2d Oct started home - heavy rain storm staid all night at Mrs. Sarah Clarks
3d arrived home - very warm weather.

4th Oct Ann taken sick with Cholera Morbus
5th a little better - very warm and has been for some time past
8th rainy - went to Sabbath school
9th rain storm now - cooler 50º
10th Big rain storm. A Mink is killing off our chickens. yesterday we lost 13 chickens and today 1 old hen
13th Thunder storm last night - cooler 56º
14th clear + pleasant - Sarah Clark + Ann went to Nat. Sniffins visiting
16th Rain storm again
17th Registered voters Morton
18th Wrote letter to ABR
20th 2º above freezing - white frost - Paid Ministers subscription $20.00
22nd cool + pleasant morning
25th went to Peoria, Deposited in Bank $220.00
30th Oct Thunder storm
1st Nov. cooler - rain showers took up ___
5th rain storm. thunder
7th Nov. Election polled 226 votes - got home at 2 oclock AM next day - moderate weather
9th rain storm with thunder
10th rain rain very disagreeable weather - Mooberry sale - muddy
12th picked(?) corn - very warm - rain at night - rain turned cold
13th 1º below freeezing - first freezing this fall - cold wind - Josiah Quincey Died in Boston
14th clear 8º below freezing

Nov. 20/82 cloudy + gloomy weather for several days [August 25]
21st clear + frosty - 4 below freezing
___ Lester sold his hogs 21 got ^.00 per head came to $376
24th 12º below freezing - finished picking corn - pleasant weather
26th first snow nearly 5 in. moderate at freezing - Lester went to Church in a sled
27th went to Peoria - drew Dividend of $725.00 Thurlow Wood Died age 81 - born in Cairo N.Y.
30th Thanksgiving day 12º above zero - pleasant day - our Children all home except Junius [August 26]
3d 12º below freezing rough roads
5th snow storm - Lester starts for Indianapolis
6th 10º above zero - Transit of venus - 120 yrs to another like it - good sledding now - Mr. Dodds visited here. snow storm again
7th 13º below zero clear + bitter cold. a mink killed 3 hens in a coop - at 12 oclock 6º below
8th 8º below zero - wind south cloudy
9th birth day 75 yrs snow storm - Jacob Slough - an old tavern keeper of Peoria
12th Lester came home from Indianapolis last night - warm looks like [August 27] rain
13th 10º above zero snow squall
14th Lester putting up ice
15th 3º above zero
16th 3º below zero clear
17th snow storm 2 in last night
19th sleet - Mrs. Horace Hancock Died of cancer of the stomach
19th approved collectors Bond - Earth quake in Vermont - severe - foggy
20th Rain all night and all day - killed of beef
21st still rainy + foggy
22nd freezing - cloudy + gloomy - bad roads
23d 10º below freezing clear.

[August 28]
Jan. 19, 1883 - let Lull have $20.00
Feb. 5      "        "    "    "   4.20

[August 30]

25th Christmas - rain storm - will spoil our ceremonies [September 1] I fear much
27th 10º below frozen 
28º 14º below freezing - warm wind south again Chester Cole called here
Dec. 30th snow squalls. Anson Gillum visited here
1st Jan. 1883 10º above zero. light snow falling
2nd 5º below zero - killed hogs - for meat
3d NE snow storm 2 in
